Reviews.Title: “Room selection is the key”
Reviews.Author: CAKath2
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel but it is very clean and the staff is EXCEPTIONAL, everyone from the front desk staffer to the maintenance man we asked about the ice machine. Keith even called 10 minutes after we were in our room to check that it was quiet enough for us. The location is wonderful - within easy walking distance Little Italy and all of great restaurants and Seaport Village. We paid for a small double room and we got what we paid for. It was adequate for our stay with good storage, recently remodeled, flat screen TV and plenty of bath linens and toiletries. At check-in we were given a complimentary drink in the restaurant/bar on the 4th floor. It has recently be refurbished and has a great vibe and interesting happy hour menu. It overlooks the San Diego harbor so it is hard to beat the view at sunset. The room also included a very simple breakfast in this space. The caveat to this hotel is requesting and receiving a quiet room. There is major construction on one side so your best bet is an interior room. We heard late night arrivals in the hall but no noise once people were inside their rooms. If you are looking for value in a great location, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cindyCostaMesa
Reviews.Content: Research deals and then ask if hotel can beat what you have found. Try to get full breakfast (not continental which is basically just cereal) Also ask for free drink cards. Ask for Keith at front desk to discuss what kind of room you want. He was very accomodating and pleasant to work with. Ask for the fully renovated deluxe rooms as anything below are extremely small and very dated. Room 359 was a great room. Because of construction, get an inside room.(no view, but quiet) Check room for anything missing (burnt out lights, missing refrig. for us). The hotel quickly took care of it. Very comfortable beds. Each morning call desk to request room be made up that day. Glass door restaurant has amazing view. Go for cocktails or meal. Ask for complimentary grilled bread with drink (not on menu). Can walk to many attractions and restaurants. Had great pizza at Filippes.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: Christine N
Reviews.Content: Location is what this hotel has going for it. It's right in the middle of Little Italy with all kinds of restaurants and little shops around and walkable to the bay. You can walk half a block and suddenly be in the thick of things. However, the room was sub-par--it was cramped, the decorations were old, and it lacked amenities or even a guide to the hotel. The front desk was overly casual and not helpful in terms of answering questions. If returning to the area, I would probably stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Okay”
Reviews.Author: gg345
Reviews.Content: My mother treated my wife and I to a weekend in San Diego. She booked the hotel through Living Social. It wasn't until we were on the road that I decided to check on reviews of the hotel we would be visiting. My jaw dropped at some of the first reviews that popped up. Expecting the worse, I was pleased that it was not as bad as some described. First off, this is a motel, not a hotel. The first room we were given was pretty clean. The lamp shade and some of the vents needed dusting, but the linens, bed and restroom were fine. The carpet and curtains, along with the art on the walls need some serious updating. It also needed some upkeep. One of the dresser knobs fell off when I tried to open it. The TV needed some adjusting. The picture was snowy on every channel but it was clear in my mothers room. The walls are so thin that you hear every plane that flies over and several police car sirens throughout the night. When we woke up in the morning, the power started fading, the lights and TV until it would blackout. After a few minutes, we realized that the bathroom light stayed on when the power went out (about 5 times). We called the front desk and in less than 5 minutes a hotel worker was there. We were trying to explain what was happening when the room blacked out in front of him. He called the front desk for us and we were given another room. This was a much bigger room than our previous room, but I would not say it was better. The door splashed guard on the bottom of the door was missing from both sides of the door, leaving a 2 inch gap of light and sound coming into the room. The room also had a glass wall/ sliding door separating the room from the bathroom. The bathroom window had no curtain or shading and the glass wall did nothing to stop the bright morning sunshine from showering us at 6am in the morning. I don't know if it was being on the 5th floor or the 2 inch gap on the door but the planes and sirens were 5 times louder. I did not get any sleep this night. The lobby was nice and the restaurant has a great view. The staff was also friendly. Overall it was not as doom and gloom as many of the reviews, but it really does need some upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: travellerAvondale_az
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these hotel for 4 nights last february for a tour in san diego area. The room was so small that we have to bring our stuff back in our car every now and then. But the catch is, receptionist and customer service is awesome. Valet parking was a good idea rather than parking on the stree,which was at your own risk.They will help you find your way and guide you to good deals around town. Location is great, walking distance to some attractions, just 2 blocks from the farmers market hapenning on saturdays. Overall stay was okay, we didnt usually stay a lot in the hotel, was almost gone everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaintedCanvas1975
Reviews.Content: My wife got a deal on this hotel through Living Social. We decided we were going to arrive a day early, so she booked a total of 3 nights there. Our first night was in another room type, than the room that was purchased on Living Social. We ask for the quite part of the hotel, and the girl at the front desk said that there was construction across the street, and she would put us on the other side of the hotel. She gave us room 305, which was directly across from the construction. We didn't complain because it was only 1 night. The room was very basic, with a sink but no microwave. The pillows in this room were soft, and more comfortable than the following day. We arrived back at the hotel early the following morning, and talk to the different person at the front desk about moving to the other room. He said he would call the room when it was ready. Around 2:30pm, the house keeping knocked and we told them we were waiting for our other room to open up. They let me know it was ready. We moved all our stuff to room 414. This room was a little smaller, but not a big deal. This room had harder pillows, and a microwave. After trying to sleep on the stiffer pillows, we called down to ask for softer pillows and the female at the front desk said that all their pillows were the same. Our room was facing the freeway, but we heard the freeway very little. The bathroom was nice size, but the sink was a pedestal sink, which made it hard to get ready. There is a sink in the room, which we felt was a big waste of space. Overall it wasn't the biggest room for the money, but it seemed clean, and we got a decent nights sleep. We ate at the Glass Door restaurant. The menu is very limited, but the food was very good. We expected the basic bar menu, but the food was much better than we expected. We got a salad with Lobster on it. There was a small amount of lobster, but it was a good salad. I got a Ribeye, and my wife got a chicken menu. We both enjoyed our meals. It is $22 to valet your car with the hotel, which is necessary because parking around the hotel is a pain in the butt. The biggest negative about the hotel is that the room doors open to outside. The hotel is open down to the basement garage, and you can sometimes hear cars going in and out in the middle of the night. The hotel is close to most things in San Diego. I am sure there are better hotels in the area because most of the area looks rebuilt in the last 10 years.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "Hotel" Experience of my LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: sheri j
Reviews.Content: Took our family to stay at this "hotel" over Spring Break. Our experience went from bad to worse at this hotel. Only 15 tabs of toilet paper were left on the one remaining roll when we first entered the room upon checkin. The pull-out bed wasn't made up (a request i made at time of reservation and at check-in). When we called down to front desk, they said that the housekeeping staff went home for the night (5pm) and couldn't accommodate our request. We then asked to please send up linens and toilet paper and we would make up bed. We had to make 3 calls to the front desk over a 2 hour period to have this done. The air conditioning unit in our room was extremely load (my husband said it sounded like a garbage disposal trying to clear a large amount of food) the lights in the bathroom didn't work. The next morning, we left the room at 9am and returned after 3pm. When we returned, our room had not been cleaned. We called to the front desk asking for housekeeping service to clean our room while we left for dinner. We returned at 6pm and room wasn't cleaned. We called down to the front desk asking for our room to be cleaned and guess what? The housekeeping staff had gone home for the day! But, they offered to bring up a vaccum so that we could clean our own room. Appalling! We asked to speak to the manager and learned that we were speaking to the manager! We decided to leave immediatly and demanded for our night stay to be removed. (we had planned to stay 3 days but couldn't spend one more minute, let alone spend another dime on this place!) The manager that we spoke to had no authority to meet our requests. When we checked out, the manager at the front desk was going back and forth from his roll at front desk to valet. I have never had a more miserable experience in a hotel in my life. Nor have I ever left early from a vaction due to a terrible hotel experience. Do yourself a favor, do not stay here! Lobby is nice, restaurant and bar nice but the rooms are comparable to a very low-budget motel. We requested a Junior Suite with the hopes that it would be well appointed...NOT SO! Hotel boasts of room renovations, but our room clearly wasn't a part of this remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here at all!”
Reviews.Author: Angela I Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First of all the hotel is basically like a motel 6 in quality of rooms. And they surprise you with hotel fees at the end of your stay and charge you $22 a night for valet parking. It was close to attractions as well as the airport. So you were able to hear the nearby freeway, the noise of the street, and the taking off and lading of planes. As well as the nearby train. Would not stay here even if they paid me to.

Reviews.Title: “Porto Vista”
Reviews.Author: RozBishop
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean spacious, comfortable. Walking distance to Gaslamp quarter, Little Italy and the Balboa Park. Staff extremely helpful and friendly. Highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Porto potty MOTEL is more like it”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: First off, NOT a hotel. there are exterior corridors, my room was on first floor looking out towards a dumpster. internet is advertised on the website as a $10 value, but it wasnt working, so should I not get a $10 refund?? Also arrived at 130pm and they would not allow me to check in. they made it seem like all maids would be cleaning all the rooms simultaneously and none would be ready until 3pm. I mean if a room is turned over and its available let your patrons in! Surrounding area is nice, first time in little italy, but last time at porto potty motel!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Amy A
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this hotel was not "all that". The main photo is the western view where the restaurant, Glass Door, is located which is great and romantic! The rest is like a motel--all interior views like a cheap motel. We had to move because the first was so musty. The "remodeled" room was only better because the ceilings were higher & had a large window in the bath. Will only stay there again in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “great location,poor service”
Reviews.Author: Xiangyu Cecilia J
Reviews.Content: I didn't have high expectation on this hotel since I've read the reviews on tripadvisor before I went. but I am still very disapointed.. not because of the small room without fridge and hair drier, but the poor service.. The first night finding out there was no hair drier in the room.. I called the front desk and the guy said he would send someone to bring us one. but after 20 mins, no one was coming.. I went to the reception by myself to take it, but the guy at the reception said he didn't have one there, he had to call someone to get it.. and he didn't even sounds friendly.. I went back and started watching a movie, and after one hour, still no one came.. I called again and the guy said sorry, he'll send someone right away, then another 10mins, again, no one came.. I called again, and being ignored this time.. so disappointed.. if you cant find one, can you just say sorry and tell me that?.. other than that, the location is great, very close to little Italy, where you can find a lot of good places to eat and hang out. the roof resteraunt has a good view too. but.. I'll never come back..

Reviews.Title: “Very Good if you're prepared for what you're getting”
Reviews.Author: TGP67
Reviews.Content: The thing I most appreciate about TripAdvisor is the chance to get to know a property and properly set your expectations on it before showing up. The Porto Vista Hotel is one of those places where you can have a great time if you know what you're signing up for. Know up front that you: Will pay $22 for on-site valet parking Are staying in an older, remodeled motel-type property Won't have a pool or hot tub May have a small room, without much of a view These seem to be the things that disappoint the most, especially when you're unprepared, and frankly, I set my expectations low. However, I had booked a very nice rate on kayak.com. So I was actually pleasantly surprised to find the Porto Vista was not the bad property some reviews had prepared me for. My sister and I were assigned a double room on the 4th floor, facing quiet State Street. The room was plenty big, clean and in good shape. While the furniture seemed to have been held over from before the remodel, it looked fine. The beds were quite comfortable, with soft linens and plenty of pillows. We had a flat screen TV, wet bar sink, microwave and refrigerator. The bathroom was clean and remodeled, with European style fixtures and stone tile flooring. People have mixed opinions on the large B/W photos adorning one of your walls, but I really liked it. There is free WiFi. It was somewhat flaky during our stay but great when working. Porto Vista seems to have a lot of different room styles, so we may have lucked out with one of the better ones. The roof has a great view, but otherwise there's not much going on. Most of the space looks like it can be booked for private parties, and it's closed off to other guests. The Glass Door is the on site restaurant, and it was nice. On a Saturday night, it was loud and crowded, so we didn't even catch a drink there. But it was perfect for an enjoyable Sunday breakfast, with creative dishes and a perfect view of the bay. The service was very friendly - from our server in the restaurant, to the front desk staff to the valet. Location is one of the best features - walk out the front door and you're a block from the restaurants and shops of Little Italy. We had dinner at Prep Kitchen, and it was wonderful. The best part was being able to stroll 3 blocks from dinner and be back at the hotel. It's a nice neighborhood for a Sunday morning stroll. Since it's also somewhat residential, you can take in a lot of neighborhood activity. We paid in the low 100s, and I thought this was very reasonable for what we got. At that rate, I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: Grace T
Reviews.Content: This place was OK for the money and pretty good on the location. The room was small and had a bit of a smell but the service from the fron desk staff including Keith and Vanessa were really responsive to our request for a room change and helped make our stay much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Italy experience - 4th floor rooms smelled very good”
Reviews.Author: Olga S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in March in Upgrated rooms (had 2 rooms) on the 4th floor. I got scared by previous reviews about the smell and mold in bathrooms and agreed to the upgrated rooms and it was probably worth it because there was no mold or bad smell anywhere. The hotel building is indeed old, and the rooms felt like renovated and dressed up old rooms, but they did quite a good job on it. The King deluxe with the balcony had new toilet and bathtub and felt very fresh, bed was super comfortable with thick mattress, had refrigerator and microwave, there was some ocean view on the side of the balcony. The double queen room was large, had old toilet and on-floor-shower, but definately no mold and was clean. Mattresses were super thick. TVs were flatscreens and bright in both rooms. All locks and doors worked fine. The only thing we didn't like was The glass door restaurant which is kind of a separate business obviously popular with public, so we let them have it the way it is. Its not just overpriced, its uneatable. There's plenty alternative places to eat in the area. The other thing I liked was how quiet it was being a block away from India street. Rooms were cleaned as expected, service was not annoying. We had quite a pleasant experience. Vallet parking is 22 dollars though. Parking on the street is possible, not on Saturday or Friday night, and you have to pay at the meter anyway. We didn't have to use any air condition in March so I know nothing on how good or bad it is.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, good value and good access to downtown and the surrounding area.”
Reviews.Author: adventurebuddy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a last minute type site that doesnt tell you the hotel till you book and I have to say it easily lived up to its rating. It is a great location for both downtown, little Italy and the freeway. The rooms were spacious and clean with a microwave. The hotel staff were very friendly and the valet staff very quick. If you're looking for a reasonable place to stay then this is a good option. It is essentially a motel with a fancy lobby but if all you need is a clean and comfortable room for the night then consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan”
Reviews.Author: LifeTourist1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work a couple of months ago, and it was horrible. To give you an idea of the ambiance, it was like someone bought an old motel, then went to the Standard in LA, and said, yes, that is what I will do, only to fail miserably. I slept with a chair propped up under the door, the old air conditioner and bathroom only revealed the dodgy former self of this hotel. Also, the paying issue was a pain. My firm booked the room for me on our corporate card. Instead of notifying anyone of their policy, I showed up to be told that they could not put the room on the corporate card because I myself did not have it in my possession. They then said that they faxed my firm to get authorization, but when I came back the following day, both people that I told them to fax it to denied receiving the authorization fax. It was just a mess. I travel a ton for work, and this has never-ever been an issue before. The little hipster elements do nothing to help the overall experience, in fact the giant photo of a girl looking over my bed just creeped me out. The ambiance of the walk to the room is something like low-income housing meets a motel by the hour. Also, I wasunexpectantly running late from my meeting. Instead of helping me get my stuff out so I could check out - bag right by the door ready to go, they said no and charged me for it. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service....okay room”
Reviews.Author: sabrina s
Reviews.Content: Booked a room from a great Groupon special. Customer service was AMAZING at this hotel and this is the main reason I have given it a very good rating. Otherwise would have been just okay if not dissapointing. The room was not as advertised, cute hipster room. It was a somewhat updated 90's Tuscany style room. Our bathroom had really bad mold and made the room smell like BO/smelly feet. They came up and deodarized the room, but we had to keep the window in the bathroom open our entire stay or I would have had some serious headaches from the mold. Though we had gorgeous views of the city skyline and the bay soooo wasn't too bad. Location was perfect and everyone from the managers to the janitors/handyman were super nice and friendly. Everyone wanted to make sure you had a great experience. The only downside was the room. But for the price, location, and service this hotel cannot be beat. VERY DOG FRIENDLY!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Chelexi
Reviews.Content: There must have been a convention going on the same weekend I was there because almost all the hotels I wanted to stay at were fully booked and /or the hotel rates were starting $275 -$300! I didn't want to pay that much just for 1 night, so I took my chances and booked a room on http://priceline.com and put in my bid for $140 for a 2 1/2 star hotel. I ended up getting a room reservation at The Porto Vista and from the pictures I saw, the hotel and rooms looked decent. I had seen bad reviews on http://tripadvisor.com but I brushed it off hoping that my experience would be different. The hotel from the outside looks good and the lobby area is clean and modern, but I can't say the same for the rooms, very, very disappointing!! From what i saw on the outside compared to the room was a disaster! I got a standard room with one queen bed and the room is TINY! My bedroom alone is bigger than the room! There was barely any room to fit my twin sized air mattress, and the room definitely needs renovation ..from the furniture, to the T.V, to the bathroom. I'm not claustrophobic, but staying in that room made me uncomfortable because there was no actually walking space and everything was so close to each other. I've stayed at the Super 8 and Comfort Inn in downtown SD ..and both are better and have bigger rooms too!! Pro: located in Little Italy and walking distance to shops and restaurants Cons: SMALL rooms, old furniture, outdated T.V's, ugly bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Great facade on the MOTEL... Nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Rogerfpowell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Porto Vista on 3/2/12. The lobby is nice, the club is nice, the exterior looks nice, the neighborhood (Little Italy) is beautiful!! BUT: The rooms are comparable to a Motel 6, the carpets in the hallway are dirty/stained... This must have been a crappy motel that was "remodeled", the parking structure under my room was filled with junk! Old TVs, vacuums, furniture, etc. Looked like a ghetto. SEE PIC ATTACHED!! I decided to leave after one night to stay at The Indigo, in the Gaslamp (THAT was nice!!). Anyway, the morning of my departure, I watched the valet pull my car into another car!! Needles to say, I will never stay in this dump again... Oh, the staff was SUPER friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Centrally located in little Italy, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Unclemando7
Reviews.Content: The Porto Vista Hotel is centrally located in San Diego in the little Italy district. The rooms are decently sized but the bathrooms are tiny. Be prepared to spend 22 dollars a night for valet parking as no self parking is available. This is typical of downtown San Diego hotels. The rooms recieved a good update with flat screen television and a retro look by placing a life size print of a woman on the wall. Don't plan to get much sleep on the weekends as you can hear people coming in late, talking, walking, heels clogging. Hotel is combined with residential leases. Great hotel for the younger crowd on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: marin215
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews of this hotel I have misgivings even being part of the amateur reviewer process. Dumb remarks like "don't stay here, the manager wasn't nice to us" are not helpful. So I wasn't sure what we'd think. So after two nights at the Porto Vista, here's my own two cents/recommendations : 1. The location is great. I wouldn't want to be right on India street for noise reasons. The airplanes come close, but as soon as we closed our balcony door it was quiet. We let them pick us up at the airport and waited to rent a car while we did city stuff--so parking not a problem. 2. Beds are super comfortable. After walking around the city and Balboa Park we slept like logs. 3. Great to have a fun place for an end of the day cocktail--great view a bonus (Glass Door). 4. Spring for a larger room. It's still small but you'll be able to walk around. 5. Daytime management seems with-it, night-time staff not as much. But they did give us some towels and coffee when we found housekeeping had forgotten to clean our room(!) 6. It's not fancy. If you want fancy or you are really high maintenance, you'll have to spend more money! But it's comfortable and good for folks like us who don't care for cookie-cutter Holiday Inn places. In the end, my husband said, "It's weird, because I wouldn't rave about this place but I'd definitely stay again!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: JonesJess
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely nice and helpful. It was in a fabulous location; few min walk to a number of restaurants and a short drive to the Gaslamp Quarter. Very clean, comfortable rooms. Negatives: limited street parking, but offer valet for $22 a day, weak Wi-Fi connection, and some airport noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: kirrabob
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, freeway, trolley, waterfront and walkable to downtown. Best part is that it's in Little Italy with many restaurants to choose from. Rooms are nice, hotel is about 2 years old. It's a 3 star at best. There is some airport noise here. Daily parking fee of $22 is a joke, use the free or meters on the street instead. Don't be put off by beggars in the nearby park or on India Street... that's just part of San Diego downtown living.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Awesome Value, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: angelique n
Reviews.Content: All staff was helpful, especially Keith Johnson and the two Friday night vales! It is in the perfect spot. I have stayed here since it opened and it is always clean!! I ask the staff handfuls of questions about the area each time. Not only did they provide a map but recommended all the great things to do in the area. Saturday's farmers market is a walk away, Little Italy is a breathe away, the ocean view is great, they have a nice spot to eat that is actually getting a face lift so looking forward to that, the airport and train station are close, it's the perfect gateway spot if you are looking to get out of LA or come visit San Diego for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel, Awesome Value”
Reviews.Author: Jessica L
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, Lobby modern, rooms large with a modern contemporary feel, great views of the the water and service was great! Value was good with breakfast included in room rate. the location was nice to go sightseeing in different areas of the city and have Italion food in Little Italy. I would go back again in the future. Different from your typical hotel. You will OVE the murals!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Brian H
Reviews.Content: As a student not having too much funds I wanted to getaway with my girlfriend and impress her, so i decided on this hotel in San Diego. The location was great because of all the restaurants and galleries that sorronded the hotel. Upon arrival I was greeted by the valet person who took my car. The lobby was nice and modern with comfortable couches to sit on. The front desk was nice and provided additional information on the hotel and if I wanted a upgrade, and because she was so nice I decide to splurge a bit so I git a room that had a balcony and even provided a $25.00 credit which i could use for anything. The room was clean, the bathroom had a deep bathtub which i i scored with my girlfriend and all done in marble. The bed was extremely comfortable! We had WIFI and was complimentary. We had brunch the next day in the restaurant with awesome view of the city. I would definitely come back. Enjoy and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Fuvion
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in the San Diego area and found this hotel accidentally. The rooms are large, great view. FANTASTIC value for the price range. The room was clean, spacious, awesome bathroom and the internet was free. Valet parking was a bit on the high side but justifiable due to limited parking in the Italian district area (Little Italy) where the hotel is situated. The restaurant had great views and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mavees a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited the hotel last week for our 8 year anniversary and we had a wonderful stay. It is so close to down town Gas Lamp District which is filled with great things to do, a few blocks from the Bay and one block from India St. which has lots of great cafe's, restaurants, bistros and shopping. The rooms are very comfortable but the staff was AWESOME. They were very helpful in guiding us on where to go and where to eat. Thanks for the wonderful stay. We hope to visit you again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Little Italy, San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a quick 2-night vacation to San Diego where we stayed in this artsy, stylish renovation of a hotel! Located right in the Little Italy district, we were able to park here and walk throughout the shops, parks, and restaurants with ease! The decor of the lobby and lounge/restaurant are really cool, and the rooms are well done. It is an older hotel building, so our room was a bit small, but for the 2 of us (plus our dog - it is Dog-Friendly, which was a HUGE plus for us!) it was all we needed to crash in while out and about. Regarding the room, the furnishings were nice! Artistic wall, flat screen & new furniture. It was small, and our room must have been close to some pipes, because we definitely could hear running water when someone else was using the shower. This was the bit that was annoying - the building is older, so the walls are not as sound insulated as some other places. In fact, one day we got back to the room for a break in the early afternoon and we could here construction (renovation?) that was happening on the ground floor (we were on the 3rd). Part of that is the courtyard openings of the hotel, so it was open to the parking, etc. on the ground floor. Service was good - and they made it easy for a dog to stay with you. The hotel is suited to allow dogs without it being a disturbance to others and easy to navigate the hallways/lobby. Little Italy itself is very dog-friendly, so this was a nice way to vacation. (A flat fee for the dog regardless of how many nights you stay!) There is a park (not dog-park) just to the East of the hotel, so easy to take the dog to do its duty. Little Italy had dog pick up bags all over the place, making it a great stay! I'll review the restaurant - The Glass Door - separately but lets say its worth a trip to the hotel just for the view, and the food was good! Overall, it was a quality hotel...good value for a great location. Walking distance (5-10 min) even to the harbor, the whale watching tours, and USS Midway aircraft carrier. Balboa Park is a short (5 min) drive away with all you can do there! We will definitely keep this place on our too stay list next time in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Advertised to be cute, but more or less a motel 8”
Reviews.Author: Annielee1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an iPhone app and it was advertised to be a cute, chic boutique at the heart of little Italy in San Diego. The lobby was about the only thing that was cute. The rooms are small, hardly any walking space, no space on bathroom counters. The room that we were in had the strongest musty smell that it made sleeping quite difficult, even after using half a bottle of perfume, it was still there. The noise was the worse. We were told that there was some "Disney on Ice afterparty" up stairs. But upon reading these reviews, I now realize that loud noise is probably a regular occurrence. I didn't like that the rooms were open to the outside; it felt unsafe especially with the droning of the loud AC, with that and everything else made me feel like I was in a dingy motel going to get slaughtered by an outsider. Also, valet is way overpriced around $30, found a parking spot on the street. Positives: staff is friendly and there is free wifi. However, I will not stay here again not even if it was $50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Pros:staff is friendly & courteous!Cons: dirty room & noisy”
Reviews.Author: MrSL0TS
Reviews.Content: Greetings again! Here's my review on the Porto Vista hotel in San Diego which we chose from the Hotel Tonight app. Let me start by saying this phone app rocks! If you use my invite code: dstanert , you will immediately have $25 credits to use ( I just checked & the Stratosphere is listed on the HT app today for $23! Yeeks! free room in Vegas)anyways back to my review: Pretty lobby but that's it. Room doors faces the outdoors. With noisy ac unit under window. Carpet had white stains(large palm size). Tub leaked. Red spots on comforter. Lots of noise at 3am. Sounded like a party next door. Front desk said it was due to people returning from downtown bars, probably true however the other hotels we've stayed at in the Gaslamp district were quiet....

Reviews.Title: “Yowza!”
Reviews.Author: thecakeparlor
Reviews.Content: Rooms are not what they look like in the picture, I'm pretty sure this was a motel 6 previously with giant murals on the walls to make it look "boutique"... We had booked 2 nights, but immediately after check in were disappointed and stayed one due to "hotel policy" charging us, and booked a beautiful room at the OMNI downtown!! Needless to say, I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes!”
Reviews.Author: greengardener
Reviews.Content: I should have read these reviews - I was in a hurry and booked it. Rooms not good - I didn't even have a bar of soap in the room or tissues and they told me to come down and get it. It clearly is a party hotel - I was awakened throughout the night with drunken people coming in laughing, shouting etc. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is the place's best feature”
Reviews.Author: ChrisinSOCA
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in San Diego recently. Picked this place in the Little Italy area as it's close to downtown and other areas we planned to visit. While I'd like to say that this hotel was worth the price, it wasn't. From a cockroach in the bathroom to jets landing it seemed at times almost overhead, from noisy air conditioners to squeaky doors, from staff that were not all that helpful to rooms that need a face lift, this place had plenty of things that say Avoid It. If the rooms had been sub-$100, then maybe we'd have been OK with some of the inconveniences, but since they were not you'd be better off staying someplace else in the area. Oh yes, they are constructing a new building right next door also so you get to hear construction noises.

Reviews.Title: “Porto Vista Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlrdiet
Reviews.Content: Great Location!! I stayed at the Porto Vista Hotel for 2 nights for a conference. Close access to train made it easy to get around the city. Hotel is a block away from Little Italy, which was great because the food there is fantastic. My room was a little small, bed was very comfortable. I received 2 complimentary drink passess for the restaurant on site, but did not have the chance to eat there. Overall, great hotel for the money. Location, Location, Location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs! Insulting management!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week. I woke up on Tuesday morning and found blood spots on the sheets. I knew that this was a sure sign of bed bugs, so I kept watch and slept rather poorly on Tuesday night. I woke up a bit past mid night and found the actual bug on my leg. While the front desk did move me to another room, I was told that a manager would be contacting me. When I hadn't heard from them on Thursday evening, I called them. The manager of the hotel only kept saying "what do you want me to do?". I told him that I should be compensated by the hassle of drying, washing, and laundering everything to an extreme before I walked into my house so as not to bring the bed bugs into my own home... not to mention the WORRY of bringing these things with me. The manager questioned the validity of my claim and offered drink coupons... (!!!) This was extremely insulting. I informed the management that the sheets still have the blood spots on them, even if the "maintenance crew" didn't see the actual bugs. The manager even suggested that "it would not have been a bad idea" to carry the bed bug with me as proof! The other reviews here are also true. It is basically a motel. They have taken pictures of the only nice spots of their hotel (lobby and roof top dining area). The courtyard where the rooms are is a giant parking lot. The rooms are cramped and you have that dirty sense when you walk into them. This is the very first time I have ever written a review or complaint. It's not my way to complain or be indignant. I have stayed in many hotels both for business and pleasure. But I felt compelled to come here after my experience. In the end, I was given nothing but a room change and an insulting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mala Porto Vista”
Reviews.Author: MrCMartin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights during a recent trip to SoCal, and even though I got a pretty good deal, I don’t think I would stay here again. The building itself looks very modern from the outside with a cool, chic lobby and friendly staff, but when it came to the rest of the hotel, I was not impressed. My first view after stepping off the elevator on my floor was one that reminded me of an old motel because the rooms were entered from the outside. They all had large windows that could be viewed in to, and each room had an air conditioner that stuck out of the wall next to the door. Even though the carpet was a little worn, the furniture in the room was nice. The bed was very plush and very comfortable, the armoire looked pretty new and was large, and the dresser was good. My only complaints about the furniture were that the television was outdated, and there was a desk right next to the dresser without a chair. So, it was unusable. Overall, the room was just too small for all the furnishings. The bathroom was adequate. Although I was not impressed with the room, I will say that the hotel had a great view of Little Italy and beyond. Go to the top floor for a relaxing view and fresh air. It was also in a great location being so close to dining, bars, and the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: sweetsook
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a 3 night stay and ended up staying extra two nights because of the location and service. The employees were helpful and rooms were clean. Price per night was decent as well. I would stay again and would recommend others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Brooke M
Reviews.Content: As an ex-resident of San Diego’s Little Italy, I can say with confidence that Porto Vista is perfectly placed in the neighborhood to take advantage of all it has to offer. You can put the car away on Friday and not think about it again until late Sunday afternoon when you reluctantly leave. There are dozens of delicious and inviting restaurants within a five to six block radius. There is a row of unique boutiques packed with treasures to explore on Fir, right in front of the hotel. There’s an English pub, a craft cocktail spot, one of the oldest dive bars in all of San Diego, the beautiful stretch of waterfront for walks/runs, a firehouse museum, cafes with perfectly brewed espresso, gelato shops… you get the picture. The creators of Porto Vista know they have a gem of their own and have maximized it with the Glass Door restaurant. That gem is the view. This is my single favorite spot to watch sunset downtown; you are just high enough up to take it all in, feel the breeze, watch the boats, look down on the neighborhood as twilight washes over – all while sipping your favorite glass of wine or cocktail. Well done PV, the neighbors say “Thank You”. Take heed though, this means you’ll have to compete with the neighbors for seats and if you show up at 5:30 on Friday you will probably not get an outdoor seat. However, there is a huge upper balcony that guests can enjoy. I’ve seen pictures of weddings being held up there, so there is almost always room to spread out, even with a group of friends, you’ll just have to hold off on that glass of wine until you can go back to the bar. The hotel itself is cute in that boutique sort of way. They’ve definitely got a sense of style and are economic in the distribution of those touches. We got a room on the north side of the fourth floor, complete with balcony. They are spacious with a desk, wet bar, armoire, king bed and an arm chair. The bath was large enough for two to be in comfortably. The carpet, sheets, towels and sundries were what you would expect in a mid-range hotel (think Holiday Inn… just with style) – nothing fancy, but clean and suitable for a weekend get-away. Best of all, this is a pet-friendly property and very dog-friendly neighborhood (play park just a couple blocks away) – so your pet can have an exciting holiday with you! I was surprised that the hotel put such a focus on the modern design but left small, old-school tube televisions in the rooms. The front desk was abrupt in their guest communication style, but this may have been a one-off for us. There is a price to pay for this concoction of boutique style, reasonable price and neighborhood placement – that is the party atmosphere and late-night noise that is common with the groups of younger guests that fill the hotel on weekends. It will bother some more than others, but to me it was a small sacrifice for the long list of positives. I would recommend this hotel to singles, groups and couples looking for an authentic San Diego weekend in the best downtown neighborhood, Little Italy. Those who come to take in the surroundings will appreciate the location, the simplicity of the amenities and the view.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore pictures, this is a bit of a dive”
Reviews.Author: ramw
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations of this hotel from pictures and the classy feel to the lobby, alas the place was pretty awful. The lobby is nice and staff are helpful. The real problem is the building and rooms. Other than the lobby and the new (and mostly empty restaurat) the whole building has a run down soviet tower block feel. Our courtyard was particularly bad, having a view of the car park. Our single queen room was of reasonable size. The bathroom is quite small with the sink in the bed room. The furniture was showing signs of wear. The room was not clean when we arrived - there were bits of what we think was tissue paper all over it. We also found a key card on the floor. We told reception after our first night and the room was cleaned properly that day. There is no main ceiling light on the bedroom instead there are 2 standard lamps. When we arrived they had been disconnected from the wall. According to reception this is because "we are an eco hotel", I don't really understand why that means guests must scramble in the dark..... Our safe did not work and neither did the one in our friends' room. After telling reception theirs was fixed our friends' but not ours. Our tv remote was broken when we arrived, and despite telling reception about it, broken it remained. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Ken K
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in the stay. First off No Parking, or should I say no free parking. 22.00 to park seems ridiculous on top of the cost of the room, but wait it gets worst. It's Valet parking for 22.00, to some people that wouldn't matter but I drive a 75,000. Corvette. This is not a car to have Valet parked unless you don't give a damn about it. Long story short I was assured it would not be moved once parked. They moved it three times. The rooms were small 19" tv, no cups of any kind for the coffee pot, but wait no coffee pot either, the maker was there, not even plastic cups for rinsing after you brush yor teeth.All I can say is never again......!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: 01_justme2011
Reviews.Content: We booked this through a third party and it's a shame that the hotel is getting a bad wrap for the false advertising done by these third party companies. When reviewing on line, some of the third parties showed this hotel had a swimming pool and complimentary breakfast. Unfortunately, it does not. The complimentary breakfast is only offered if you book DIRECTLY with the hotel. Nice place, good location, quiet and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Don't book through third parties, though, call the hotel directly to know exactly what you're getting. The restaurant on the 4th floor is really nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and treated exceptional well”
Reviews.Author: gary0639
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Porto VIsta Hotel for (5) days. After the first evening I got sick. We were staying in room 513. A schedule event occurred during the first night of my illness. The band's mixer was so loud my wife complained to the hotel management. John Fissette, Operations Manager and staff arranged for us to me moved to a suite on the second floor. Great room and the hotel staff took exceptional care of us during our stay. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who asks. Very busy hotel but they know how to handle large groups.

Reviews.Title: “Great location not much else”
Reviews.Author: Nirose42
Reviews.Content: The evening we arrived valet service was commendable and the décor in the lobby gave the feel of a trendy boutique hotel. Upstairs to the lovely Glass Door Restaurant and Lounge on the 4th floor set the tone for what we believed would be a pleasant lodging experience. The website also offers a similar feel. But consider yourself warned, appearances are truly deceiving. Photos make this place appear much nicer than it really is. We boarded the elevator for our room 323, and were shocked when we stepped out to our floor. It was like a cheap motor lodge on some remote highway that you have to stay at when there is nowhere else available. We were extremely disappointed. ( I have posted images) This hotel attempts to distract a patron’s view of the room’s flaws by slapping a huge black and white photograph on one side of the room. The remaining plaster walls are institutional blue. The draperies were wrinkled beyond belief (zoom in on drapery images) hanging just above a wall unit air conditioner that dripped out onto the worn and tattered walkway carpet outside. All rooms open to the outdoors. There are no indoor hallways only outdoor walkways. Along the walkways hang long photograph banners that are an attempt to tie the outdoors to the room decor. Looking over the railing outside the room you look down into the parking garage. The bedroom area was very, very small (15x15). The sink/bathroom area was small as well. According to the room exit/evacuation chart, (see room layout image) rooms 317 through 328 are the same dimensions. Do not accept rooms in this number span if there are more than 2 in your party. These rooms can only accommodate 2 people. If you are a person who needs room to move around, and are assigned one of these rooms, you will not be a happy camper. If you have children, you will be at each other’s throats within hours! The room did not smell fresh (I believe because they are pet friendly). Items placed within this small space include: Queen Bed (pillow top was comfortable), chest of drawers with a small (tube) TV on top, wardrobe with a small safe in the bottom, one night stand, clock radio, a table/desk with chair. Single sink area with mirror, full length mirror on opposite wall, coffee maker, and tub/shower with curtains (curved extended rod), shaving mirror, hair dryer stuffed in a bag hanging on the back of the bathroom door, iron and ironing board, and a few floor and table lamps. The wrinkled sheer curtains under the drapes offer absolutely no privacy, drapes must remain closed giving the room a closed in feel. We had difficulty accessing their internet and gave up. In the morning we walked to the Little Italy Saturday Farmers Market, and explored the area returning around 4:00p.m. to prepare for an evening out. The room had not been cleaned. We called the front desk and staff said that housekeeping cleans rooms until 5:00. We needed to change our clothes and shower so the first day our room was not cleaned. While showering, the showerhead snapped off due to corrosion. (see images) We called for maintenance who came and replaced the head while we were out for the evening. They also replaced a light bulb in one of the lamps that had been sitting with an open socket. If you need more space do not, I repeat, DO NOT accept rooms located in the central corridor of this hotel. Rooms around the perimeter appear larger according to the chart (see images) and probably more comfortable and perhaps nicer. You will have to write that review if you stay in those rooms. I do not plan to book at this hotel again and for my first visit to San Diego, I was very sorry American Express offered this hotel as a suggested place to stay. Even a staff person stated that the central corridor rooms reminded them of a youth hostel. The only positives I can offer is that the valet staff were the best!, the Glass Door Restaurant lovely, and the hotel proximity to Little Italy was perfect! These few pluses allow me to score this place with 2 stars. If you are on a very tight budget, are willing to accept a subpar room in a great location, and need a place for sleeping only then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and noisy and WAY over priced!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Domb171
Reviews.Content: Tired rooms with filthy carpets inside and mouldy ones on walkway. Airconditioning too old and dusty to dare turning on. Noise unbearable from those rooms who have the ac on during night. Ruined last 2 nights of an otherwise great stay in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “DONT COME HERE! TRUST ME! THIS PLACE RUINED MY ENTIRE TRIP!”
Reviews.Author: Drudiann
Reviews.Content: Ehere do i start...ok well first we get there @ 1030pm wet frm seaworld, cold & tired...they tell me they booked the wrong room & i got 1 bed instead of 2 w/3 kids & 2 adults but they'd give me a cot! Then they say they dont hv a pool which i was told they did...then they said the $50 incidental was only accepted by credit card.i even offered him $100 cash just to get my kids to a bed...he said no so we drove around @ 1130 looking for a visa prepaid card...finally found one he took it & when we finally got to the room we found 1 big brown spider where my kids were suppose to sleep..then i take the covers down off my bed & find another! Then sitting on TOP of the dresser was a makeup sharpener! Even if the maid wiped down the room half way she wouldve seen that! Gross! There was fingers prints all over the wood furniture & in the morning when we went to check out of the hell hole they said they couldnt refund the gift card cuz once it was taken they cant put it back..after a fight they agreed to give it back

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room, great location”
Reviews.Author: UNhappyCamper44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom, grandma, sister, and niece for a girls weekend getaway. The hotel is in Little Italy at a great location. Close to the trolly (within walking distance) that will take you all over San Diego. That is the only good thing I have to say about the hotel. Do not believe the website photos. Our room was completely outdated and had not been renovated yet. We did not have the print on the wall like the website shows. The bathroom door was a sliding glass door that was completely see thru. NO privacy from the others in your room when you were on the toilet. We were missing the smoke detector cover on the ceiling and did not have a remote for the outdated television. I called the front desk twice before someone came to the room to install the smoke detector cover. The television only got 5 channels and half the time they were fuzzy. Service was crappy. The staff was very rude and not helpful at all. The deck was completely dark and no one was up there Friday night. Saturday night, the deck was full with a 1981 High School Reunion. Very loud and noisy all night. The only nice staff member that helped us with our luggage and loading into the car when we were leaving was Mike in Valet. He was the only one we tipped our entire stay. We will NEVER stay here again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for location but I'd probably go somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Nurseviv24
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night to be close to the airport. Looks good on the outside but pretty dated and small inside. Wall air conditioning units. Nice staff. From Planet Hollywood to Harrah's Rincon to Porto Vista. Well I was pretty disappointed. Husband booked a double bed room. Got the room early and left to do sight see and see a Padres Game. Didn't even go in to check the room. Bad choice. Should have checked because when we got back and into the room. Well it was a single bed. We are a family of 5. Kids slept at the top of the bed and I slept at the end. Hubby got the floor with the comforter. Room was small and crowded with armoire, table, dresser. No fridge. Small tube TV. Bathroom OK. We didn't bother to try and get another room because they were already booked up and we we're only there for a few more hours. Moments from the Freeway. Steps away from hitting Little Italy. Filippi's is excellent. Get there early. There's a line! Moments from the water and the Gas Lamp area. Everything is CLOSE.... Didn't eat at their restaurant because we we're out most of the time. Feel bad for my sister and her family though. They stayed with us in another room close by. We left before them to catch our flight out. But later got a call from her and asked us if we we're itchy or had bites. I immediately asked Bedbugs? She said no. They called the manager and apparently they had pest control come out and check. It was FLEAS!!!! Please be aware that is a pet friendly hotel. Valet is $22. Overall I give it an average, but my sister my say otherwise. What else can I say I went from AWESOME, GORGEOUS hotels to OK....It really is good for it's location, but so are many others.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: Rayleen627
Reviews.Content: There must of been a convention going on the weekend I was staying in SD because all the hotels located in gaslamp district were sold out completely or hotel rates were at least $300 and up so I went onto priceline.com and bid $140 and my room ended up getting booked at The Porto Vista. From the pictures I saw on the website, the rooms looked decent so I figured we scored on this hotel deal. For the rate we got it was , but when we arrived to our room i was really disappointed! From the outside and the lobby area the hotel looks very modern which i love but I can't speak the same for the rooms. The room I got is sooo SMALL and definitely needs renovation all around! The furniture, T.V and bathroom needs a major face lift! My own bedroom is bigger than that hotel room! Thank goodness I was there for one night only and definitely NEVER staying there again. I've stayed at the Super 8 and Comfort Inn in downtown SD and both had bigger standard rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: 745Entertainment
Reviews.Content: I booked at this hotel before having read reviews on this site. After I read some of the reviews I stressed. I can tell you that there's really no reason to stress about this hotel. Upon arrival, I noticed that the descriptions of having to basically wait awkwardly in traffic to get into the parking garage are true. It wasn't the worst experience of my life, though. The check-in staff was friendly and helpful. However, and I believe this is more Southwest's problem than the Porto Vista's, they didn't know anything about being a Rapid Rewards partner when I asked them (as directed to do so by my confirmation from Southwest.com). The room itself was absolutely sufficient. It was clean, the bed was comfortable, and I had a great cross breeze with the two windows open. I did notice that there was carpet in the outside hallways on the lower floors (in reference to some of the reviews complaining of wet, odor-ridden carpet), but the 5th floor had none, so I didn't experience that issue. The hotel bar (the Glass Door) has a beautiful view, and plenty of open air seating. The location was great, and I found an awesome dinner about 2 blocks away in Little Italy. Overall a great experience, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Tired inside, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_Bec
Reviews.Content: Good location with Little Italy, and the Gaslamp quarter near by. Rooms were very tight and very tired, but we weren't looking for luxury, this was simply a place for us to stay whilst we explored San Diego. The $18per day is a bit steep for valet parking as there is no self parking, just parking on the street. The Glass door restaurant is very nice, but small. The food is also pretty good. All up, an ok place to stay, but don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “We visit SD often and always stay at the Porto Vista. We love it there.”
Reviews.Author: mamadeldeb
Reviews.Content: Although we come throughout the year to visit my son, who lives in SD, this particular trip was to attend my son's wedding. My son was able to have a block of rooms reserved for the guests and the price was excellent. The guests were all happy with the hotel, the location, and The Glass Door. We stayed in the suite, which was fantastic! It worked so well for us, but the one we stayed in, Harbor Suite, was directly below The Glass Door, which was noisy at certain times of the day/night. A couple of other suggestions to improve things: 1) I would rather have glass and ceramic cups in the rooms the over syrofoam ones, 2) there should be a way to have the room ready upon arrival, rather than having to wait soooo long to be placed, it makes check-in take too long and 3) the elevator is too slow. The manager, Keith Johnson, was exceptional. From the moment we arrived he had a smile and made us feel welcome. He is an excellent representative. He was pleasant and always ready to accomodate our many requests over the 4 days that we stayed . As I mentioned we were there for the wedding and had lots of special requests that we normally do not have. One of the requests was to pass out cookies as the wedding guests arrived. He had no problem with that. We wanted this to be a pleasant experience for the guests and everyone enjoyed themselves while they were there. Many mentioned they wanted to come back for another stay. Our stay was memorable and honestly, Keith was a big part of why we had such a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Location, Staff. Just one little problem...”
Reviews.Author: jlhand12189
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Porto Vista because our room was decently priced and it seemed quite lush from internet research. When we arrived near midnight after a long day of traveling, we were pleasantly surprised to find a helpful, fun, and enthusiastic staff. They readily took care of us and suggested nearby restaurants, bars, nightlife when we asked. When we got to our room on the fifth floor, we were impressed by the awesome view of the San Diego skyline and our seemingly clean and modern room. After a very comfortable shower, a visit to one of the aforementioned restaurants, and enjoyment of the hotel's rooftop terrace, we went back to our room to turn down the bed. To our surprise, we found what appeared to be a bed bug--small, round, dark brown, legged--scurrying across the sheets to seek solace on the mattress. Shortly after the girly screams and hasty packing, we bounded to the lobby where the night staff was more than willing to move us to a different room on a different floor. The room we had then was quite nice-- spacious, clean, bed bug-free. When we discussed the issue with the hotel manager, he was more than willing to comp our valet parking (which, by the way, is about $22/day and there's nowhere else to park around the hotel). Unfortunately, his reasonable allowance did not cover the cost of our vigorous laundry-ing, dry cleaning, and the new suitcases that were required to fully eradicate the threat of bed bug infestation. It was really a shame that this happened, because the hotel itself is quite chic, pleasant, and located right in the middle of San Diego's Little Italy area. I would have wholeheartedly gone back if it weren't for the critters.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rates, good location but dubious cleanliness and wretched service.”
Reviews.Author: worldnurse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding weekend. Looked great from the outside and on the web. Sadly, it is basically a flea bag with some new paint when you get to the guest rooms. Stained carpets and bedding...gross! If the staff of the horrible restaurant hadn't been so slow and mean - the price and location may have outshined the shabbiness, but they really left a lasting impression.

Reviews.Title: “Total rip-off”
Reviews.Author: lbs4j
Reviews.Content: This place is a joke. Based on their website and rates, you would think it was a trendy and cute boutique hotel in Little Italy. The lobby and restaurant are nice enough, but that's where the cute/trendiness ends. This place is essentially a Motel 6 that has not been upgraded. The rooms are tiny - there's a desk, but no chair for some reason. Not that there's room for a chair. My room smelled incredibly musty. My bathroom was dirty and when I took a shower, the tub filled up so I was standing in water up to my mid-shins. The lighting is terrible and it's just a depressing place to stay. And to top it off, the staff at the front desk and in the restaurant were painfully incompetent. I usually had to stand around for several minutes before anyone would even bother to assist me, and then even the simplest of questions were generally met with blank stares and non-answers. The location is decent, and the views from the roof are nice, but those were about the only positives. I was there for a wedding and many of the wedding guests stayed there and agreed it was awful - next time I'll do more research before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points, but run down and dirty.”
Reviews.Author: Montreal1965
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a night and enjoyed the fine location, front-desk service, and a good night's sleep on a quality mattress. I must say, however, that the room was tiny and full of shabby old furniture and accessories that looked as though they were from a flea market. As another Tripavisor reviewer has noted, the rug was filthy to the point of graying white socks. Mine turned color after just 10 minutes in the room! Yes, the hotel has some good features, but in my view it is clearly NOT a three-star hotel. Furniture would have to be updated and rugs changed or at least deep-cleaned. Visitor from Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot”
Reviews.Author: chikabolita
Reviews.Content: In the Heart of Little Italy with great rates, a nice bar and resturaunt. Just beware of Rick the valet. I dont know if he was having a bad day but he was patronizing and made my gf and i uncomfortable. Other than that it was Great!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SchelliD
Reviews.Content: WOW! I loved this place! Great customer service, great rooms, clean, trendy, location was great. My brother had to move rooms when we first got there because his was too small for him....he is a little picky!! So not only did they move him 3 times!! until he was happy, but they charged us a lower rate and had great attitudes the whole time. Love this place and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Honor Reservation - SDCC”
Reviews.Author: Roy1973
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attend the San Diego Comic Con every year in July. This will be our tenth year (2011). I always start looking ahead of time for good rates because this is a popular event and hotels go fast. On July 27, 2010, I found a good rate at the Porta Vista Hotel for 2011 event. My wife and I like the location and used to stay here when it was a Super 8. I remeber that we were a little hesitant about booking because it was nonrefundable, but we went ahead anyway. We booked directly through Porta Vista website and gave our credit card information. On June 23, 2011, I received an e-mail notification of "Reservation Rate Changes" and our total cost for staying doubled. I read on the Comic-Con FaceBook page that someone else had issues with their reservation. They stated that after calling and struggling with the Porta Vista, they canceled their reservation. My wife and I decided to cancel since we could not afford the doubled rate. When I called to cancel, I spoke with Anthony and informed him that we were canceling. After looking at our reservation, he hesitated and stated "Because it was Comic Con", there was a ten day cancelation policy. We called on day ten. He stated that he would cancel our reservation with no cancelation fees and that they would refund our credit card for the first night, which was charged on our "Reservation Rate Change". Why were our rates changed? If our credit card was charged on the "Reservation Rate Change", why was it never charged upon making the initial reservation on July 27th, 2010? Also, the "Reservation Rate Change" notification stated nothing about a ten day cancelation policy. It clearly states a 48 hour cancelation policy. I will be calling to speak with the manager as to why they did not honor their reservation. Luckily we had a second hotel booked. We almost canceled that the day before, but had forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Necessities”
Reviews.Author: urmi24
Reviews.Content: I'm from LA so we took the short 2 hour drive for a night getaway to San Diego. We reached to the hotel at 1 pm, parked our car (FIND street parking, $22 a night is ridiculous when there is plenty of street parking) and went to the lobby to check in. The employee stated rooms weren't available, but should be by 2, so we walked down a block to Little Italy (the only amazing thing was the location), finished by 2, but the rooms weren't ready till 3. Around 7 parties were waiting around till the official check in time of 3. Got to the room, it was adequate, old school TV's and a dirty bar area awaited. Also a cabinet that didn't close due to the mini-fridge's dimensions. We were excited for the complimentary continental breakfast the next day, disappointment indeed. It should be called a to-go breakfast, it's a yogurt parfait. The one I pay $5 at Starbucks for and the Sbux one is more filling and delicious. All in all, would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back”
Reviews.Author: CALVIN55
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel last weekend,and service on the front desk was ok,location of hotel very good,no pool,carpet in the room sucked,very dirty and not good enough,loud steps in front who ever goes threw made me feel that i am staying in cheap motel which would actually cost me much less,overall not very happy with this hotel,i was expecting little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Love Porto Vista Hotel plan to go back yearly”
Reviews.Author: sunkistBostonMa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Porto Vista Hotel twice in the past two years. We love this hotel, the beds are so comfortable. The rooms are clean and spacious . The location is within walking distance to Little Italy and the seaport area . The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The rooftop overlooking San Diego bay is so beautiful and breakfast at the Glass Door is a plus. I plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Like/Hate Relationship with the Porto Vista”
Reviews.Author: PrncssMBP
Reviews.Content: We reserved a very large block of rooms at the Porto Vista for our wedding and have mixed feelings about it. The price is fantastic for a basic hotel in a great neighborhood with lots to see and do. Given the great location, the price is about the only thing that makes me give three stars instead of two. We stayed in the Midway Suite, which is situated under the restaurant, and they drag the tables across the floor at 11pm and again at 7am. We called the front desk and they were unable to do anything about it. Also the sheets are incredibly itchy and the lack of a fitted bottom sheet makes the beds really uncomfortable. As a result, we chose not to sleep in the hotel, but drove home each night and returned in the morning. The parking fee has gone up to $18 - ouch! And the breakfast vouchers were a good deal when we stayed in February, providing you any entree on the menu. However, when we stayed in June, the voucher just gets you a two-egg breakfast. Similarly, when we signed up for the room block in February, they had a free shuttle to the airport, downtown and Balboa Park. When we arrived in June, shuttle is now $5 per person (cheaper to take a taxi if there are two of you!) and no shuttle to Balboa Park. Basically, the Porto Vista's only saving grace is that the rooms are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: Nixe708
Reviews.Content: Because of a missed flight connection I arrived one day late. The hotel manager was nice enough to upgrade me to a bigger, more comfortable room because of the missed night that I still had to pay for. The room was nice and big, nothing extraordinary but well furnished. The bathroom was almost as big as the room with a bath tub and a separate shower cabin. tiny complaint: no counter space in the bathroom... The biggest complaint was the gym, with a very musky stench and limited availability of equipment (two treadmills one of which didn't work, one eliptical trainer and a bike; free weights and a Total gym type machine). It felt very crowded when there were three people trying to get a workout.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what it seems”
Reviews.Author: JMK1984
Reviews.Content: Went in to this hotel kind of excited with the images they portray on the website. Looks nothing like it! Got a suite because they claim it has a jacuzzi tub in it, it's your basic whirlpool tub that fits one person. The hotel room itself was said to be able to fit 5 people, how does one expect to fit five when we as a couple fit comfortable in it. They dont have room service, no wet bar as was told. The rooms look old and out dated, No occurance of Yoga on the roof, The roof top restaurant was no where to be found. The Glass Door restaurant inside is found by elevator with cheap products for an expensive price, though the chicken was good! Worst thing about the hotel besides the look and appearance though is the staff is really unwelcoming, Poor poor customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest and Underhanded”
Reviews.Author: JanMS
Reviews.Content: This hotel changed the terms of my upcoming stay and lied about having tried to contact me. A staff member helped me out but then management changed the reservtion and *tripled* the rate. When I balked, the general manager cancelled my reservations completely. Dishonest! Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Mgst
Reviews.Content: Keys didn't work went down got another didn't work waited on the open balcony cement floor for 15 minutes before someone came up and switched our rooms. The guy who let us in was the only person on staff who looked like he was working hard and actually gave good service. We were promised a free breakfast through email for booking through the hotel and then found out because we booked through a wedding party we did not qualify. While others in the party did receive this. Our special rate for the wedding party was the same price mind you as everyone else was paying. We had to ask the front desk 2 times why they didn't care or even tried to recover it wasn't until the bride called the manager that we got what we were promised but only two for the one day. I could go on with more problems moldy ceiling dirty counters and glasses. Promise a balcony if you call the indoor outdoor walkway of a motel a balcony. Apparently this hotel bates you with overpromising and underdelivering. We left 3 days early and got a hotel that was $20 a day cheaper and 100% improvement on service room qaulity and experience. I wish the staff would have been sympathetic like the manager but they were just flat out rude. I never complain but I can't help wanting to warn others.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed - staff excellant, hotel needy”
Reviews.Author: nuts28
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff & housekeeping were very responsive to my requests. The room cleaning schedule was erratic although I was easily able to obtain supplies by going to one of the housekeeping staff carts. I had a lot of problems with my room which was dismal. The air conditioner was pathetic and didn't give out much coolness. The roof was a wonderful escape and I was often there to read and relax. The tub in the shower was extremely slippery, I had to put a towel in the tub before I felt safe in it. Likewise, the marble floor was slippery when wet and I used towels to navigate around it. My only chair had two very wobbley front legs and I had it replaced. The pillows were too large and my first night was very uncomfortable awaking often. The staff was able to replace them with smaller pillows and I slept well. Others in the party also had problems with the pillows and had headaches because of them but apparently didn't complain. I'm not sure I will return, but I may. The staff was the most delightful part of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all a 3 stars.”
Reviews.Author: travellotcities
Reviews.Content: First day missing service items. Second day big black spider in one of the towels. At night loud noises outside. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, free breakfast, exceptional view from rooftop patio room.”
Reviews.Author: LoFin
Reviews.Content: Paid avg room rate online, single night stay included two breakfast vouchers for restaurant. Friendly staff upgraded to rooftop room on check-in. Courteous even with a late night call to our room about our noise level. Mini fridge missing, but didn't need it for one night, the elevator was unusually slow for 5-floors, and ice machine in the lobby. Decent size rooms, comfy beds, large bathroom had sliding glass frosted door, good if you don't need privacy. Ample towels and above avg toiletries.. Rooftop view exceptional, lounge happy hour good, not too many choices but drinks well poured. Generous appetizers and my burger prepared as ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding outside our door no warning”
Reviews.Author: frostygirl2011
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, but a wedding was held outside on the patio Sat night with no advance notice. We needed sleep since we were working a convention. Staff didn't seem to care. Wouldn't stay again because of staff indifference

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, Loud and Full of Drunks”
Reviews.Author: mongolikescandy
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the website. This hotel is run down and not worth half the price. We came for our anniversary and booked a junior suite. The first problem appeared before we even stepped inside the lobby. There is only room for one car in the driveway, so anyone waiting for valet or trying to get in to the hotel has to wait in the street with traffic backing up behind them. AND, it's $18 per night to park. Once inside, the front desk staff is not professional. Friendly enough, but our desk agent looked like he was on the tail end of a three-day bender. No uniforms, either, and no helpful directions to your room. You're on your own. The trip to the room was rather depressing as the interior rooms overlook a parking lot and the hallway carpet is badly stained. When we arrived at our suite, we just stood in the doorway, dumbfounded. More stained carpet, second-hand furniture, pictures inexplicably hung four inches from the ceiling. The "whirlpool" bathtub was sized for a child; I'm 5'6 and had to sit upright in it. Coarse towels that smelled of mold, a couch that looked reclaimed from a back alley in Compton, no bottled water or any kind of amenity in the room save for the small shampoo/lotion bottles and soap in the bathroom. Glasses or mugs were not even provided; if you wanted to avail yourself of the tap water, you had to get it from the sink and use a paper cup. But none of that was the kicker. At three o'clock Saturday morning, there erupted a racket in the hallway that sounded like Mardi Gras gone bad. Several people screaming, shouting, laughing, running up and down the hallways - this went on for nearly an hour before someone (I think it was another poor guest torn from sleep) got the gaggle of screaming twenty-somethings to shut up. Or perhaps they passed out. But in any other hotel, the management would have shut that party down in five minutes. I will say that when we informed the hotel manager the next morning that we were going to stay at the Andaz for the remainder of our trip, he was very apologetic and told me he'd give us a deal if we ever came back. Which we won't. And neither should you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: peloha1
Reviews.Content: The overall appearance is that of a eastern-block building. The rooms were clean yet nondescript. The breakfast was less satisfactory. On our last day of 5 we lost our breakfast tickets and the front desk told us we would have to buy our breakfast. This was after having to listen to a loud wedding reception outside our window the night before. If I were you I would find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A magical litte find of luxury at a dirt cheap price that you dream of after a long flight”
Reviews.Author: BerringtonBud
Reviews.Content: We booked this delightful little hotel for one night, being the cheapest we found online, as it was to be just to rest our heads after flying from the UK.
