We were most impressed to find that this moderately priced hotel turned out to be quiet a little charmer. From stepping into the modern, plush reception, to the friendly and most efficient staff. Our room was big, clean and had a touch of unexpected character. The breakfast at the Glass Room was first class and had a wonderful view to the marina. The staff were super helpful with getting us to where we needed to go. Plus there is a rooftop area full of lounges, sun chairs and tables to enjoy a beverage and admire the view of downtown San Diego. We were so happy with this place we booked another night. Upon checkout our invoice was already prepared and we left feeling pleased to have found a place we will return to time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the look, not the planes.”
Reviews.Author: LucasK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for 3 nights from the 7th of May. Check in was quick. Rooms clean. Great selection of channels on TV. Only issue I have is with authorization. The hotel took a authorization upon check in, 3 days after check out They took their final bill total also, effectively over $1000 total. I do not accept this. After this hotel we stayed at two Travelodge properties, in Palm Springs the authorization was removed once the final amount settled. In San Francisco, they simply charged the full amount, no authorization. Location to Little Italy is excellent, however the roaring engines of planes landing at the airport was just horrible. Our room also faced the freeway, awesome. The hotel emailed me asking for an opinion & review on TripAdvisor following our stay, I responded with my comments, was not surprised not to receive a reply.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in San Diego: Porto Vista”
Reviews.Author: hoezo1151
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly personel (specially Jerald Mielrath who drove us to the airport), nice location in Little Italy. Depending on the room you are in, it can be noisy because of the nearby airport, freeway and trains. Beautiful weather all year around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and the staff was exceptionally helpful”
Reviews.Author: flynnch50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Porto Vista during the Mission Federal ArtWalk at which we participated. The staff members, from the desk to the valet parking, and the restaurant, were very helpful and friendly during this fun but stressful time. The room was lovely, comfortable, clean and well-equipped. The bed was especially comfortable after a long, hard day at the ArtWalk. I can't say enough good things about our stay! Also, it was in the heart of Little Italy and one block from our booth. We were ecstatic!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: gueishers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Little Italy where there are tons of restaurants and small great shops within walking distance. In our opinion the decoration could use a bit of an update but everything is in great conditions and the super friendly staff makes up for everything; from the valet to the sales director, to the guy who takes care of the fb page, they were all extra friendly and welcoming. The Porto Vista played a big roll on the good impression we´ve got from San Diego...we can´t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Porto Vista has lost its charm”
Reviews.Author: TrikyB
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Porto Vista numerous times. Our last stay was horrible. Our reservations were NOT what was requested. We had to pay more for the same room that we always stayed in and requested. Guests above us threw a party and were disruptive. Our complaints were ignored and the other guests partied hardy until 4:00 a.m. (On a Wednesday) Amenities were sadly lacking. No phone book, note pad, pens, services for the hotel, etc. The furniture has not been cared for and things look run down and yet the hotel is relatively new. Considering our last experience, we will look elsewhere when staying in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Guest85226
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the hotel and from check in to check out everything was fantastic! We arrived and were immediately greeted by the valet who was more than helpful then when we walked in to the lobby the front desk agent, whose name for the life of me I can't remember but it started with a D, greeted us and was friendly, helpful and full of suggestions for us as it was our first time visiting. When we got to our room it was clean and cool. We unloaded our items and off we went exploring. This hotel is in the perfect location if you are like us and prefer to walk than drive. We were close to everything and with great directions from the staff and our map they gave us we never got lost and found lots of fun little places. The next morning we had breakfast in their restaurant, great view, great service, great food. By the time we got back to our room it had already been cleaned and smelled so good. Not flowery or perfuming just very clean and fresh. The room was cleaned to perfection our entire stay and again the staff was SO friendly. I highly recommend this hotel for your next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jturtz13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was great, just a block from all of the fun at Little Italy in SD. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bar/restaurant had good food and drinks, and the view was amazing. The bed was one of the most comfortable I had ever slept in/on. The only down side to the stay was the location to the freeway and airport, as far as some noise when the windows were open. Also, if a TV in the room is a big deal then you will be disapointed, we had a 19 inch (maybe) 10 year old (at least) TV so watching some of the NCAA Tournament was hard. Overall this was an awesome stay and I would recommend Porto Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: Drworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: For what you pay, this place is a steal. The neighborhood is quaint, cute, and pretty precious. The room's are not shabby, and you get a great breakfast included. I wish it was easier to find hotels like this (ie the price) in all major cities.

Reviews.Title: “great beds!”
Reviews.Author: smkbs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the proximity to our daughters condo. It was perfect and I felt safe walking alone at night if my husband was late with the grandkids and I wanted to go to bed earlier. The food at the restaurant was very good and the service was always friendly and prompt. We plan on returning. This IS a downtown hotel and you CAN hear planes overhead at times, but the prices are certainly great for the location and service. As in many hotels of this genre, the bathrooms could use fresh caulking around the tubs, carpets could use more frequent replacing/cleaning, and someone could certainly work on the curtain rod situation! just sayin'

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Vsma38
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 weeks at the Porto Vista hotel with my children in March 2011. The staff was very helpful and efficient. The location of the hotel is perfect, it's close to everything and the hotel shuttle can take you to Seaworld and the zoo. You will find many good restaurants one block down, on India St. This hotel has reasonable prices when you see all it has to offer ( perfect location, rooms that are large enough and well-equipped, helpful staff, cleanliness, wonderful views on the harbour ... ). I really had a wonderful stay there !

Reviews.Title: “Great place to entertain”
Reviews.Author: psyline
Reviews.Content: I usually grab a suite when i travel pleasure so i can have friends over, and this trip was no different. I probably had about 10 friends through the evening, and everyone had enough room to streach, recline, stand, and enjoy conversation. My room was a King Deluxe which is on the ocean side of the building. I believe there are smaller rooms across the way, but for $80-120 range this was an excellent value. Super comfy bed, nice balcony. We ate in the hotel at the Glass Door. Excellent service from the Bar Tender Tanya, and her staff as well as well mixed drinks. The Scallops we're an excellent share; nice charcuterie platter (poss too much crustini since our party had already ordered the artichoke dip). We sat for 2 hours, and were treated like royalty, although we didn't know a soul there. To me that's a sign of great service. Breakfast for 2 was included when i booked on the hotels site, which was a full breakfast including everything except tax and tip. Yoga was also included on Sunday at no charge. I didnt make it to the roof top pool, but will next time when i'm not just in for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Trying to be a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkpotato
Reviews.Content: Customer service was okay & friendly, nothing extraordinary. Room was clean, though there was still trash (food wrappers) on the table. Bed was comfortable, & we had a good, quiet sleep night. Here's what makes it a motel room: AC was really outdated & loud, and you can see it installed right outside the room. While in the restroom, you can hear the other room's shower running. The restroom itself was just okay, though we did have Bath & Body Works amenities. The location was right near Little Italy, but far from downtown for walking. I don't appreciate the hotel website advertising $14 valet parking, & then charged us $18. My bf and I had free breakfast at the hotel's Glass Door restaurant. Nice view and decoration, but they did NOT sweep the floor from the night before because we could still see trash and crumbs. Very unprofessional. I paid $103 (after taxes) for this hotel, and expected a 3-star hotel. I was very disappointed. I should've paid the extra $20 and picked Doubletree Hotel or another hotel with dependable clean standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great service; amazing beds; superb location”
Reviews.Author: product-of-canada
Reviews.Content: Location: I was hesitant booking this hotel based on location alone, not being in the heart of downtown. But Little Italy is a really happening place in the evenings, and seemed busier than most areas downtown at night. Service: Customer service was excellent at this hotel. Dealing with a situation in our first room; the free shuttle to the zoo; holding onto our luggage after early check-out; and answering our questions - all handled very well in a customer-oriented manner. Roof top area: There are a number of areas within the hotel, especially on the 5th floor, from which to sit down and enjoy the view. I really looked forward to my evening cigar and scotch while taking in the view of downtown, Little Italy, Coronado, the airport, and incoming planes. Rooms: Initially we were in a 'Comfy Queen' room at ground level next to the parking lot, storage, and utility areas. These rooms are small and dark. If we had stayed here the whole week, I would have given this about a 3/5 review instead of the 5/5. I'm not one to complain as you get what you pay for. But a couple of days into are stay, we woke up to dripping water. I ignored it thiking it was the shower. But it was actually a fast leak from the ceiling pouring down into the open toilet, which splashed everywhere on the floor. There was a flap of ceiling plaster that had popped open where the water was pouring from. The excellent customer service mentioned above is what led to a room change into a King-size on the top floor. Beds: In both rooms, the beds were extremely comfortable. I looked forward to sleeping every night. And we needed it after very full days of excursions, sight-seeing, shopping, and eating. Other: -I was surprised to see the work-out room. Nothing fancy, but enough to get my quick work-outs done in the evenings. -The free Wi-Fi service in the rooms is hugely appreciated. This permitted us to plan our days, map destinations, and book excursions. -I like what they've done with the style of the hotel. They've taken an old motel and turned it into something trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading, dishonest business. Regret booking with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Mslaniohan
Reviews.Content: After seeing the pictures and reviews we decided to book a 2 day stay here at Porta Vista. Called the front desk and was told I'd be paying roughly $160 for both nights. When we got there we were slightly impressed by the lobby, but once we took the elevator up to our floor I was shocked. The place looked like a run down dormitory. Once inside the room I wanted to cry. A motel 6 would have been a very good upgrade. This room was small, tacky, cheap, and made you feel ripped off. We desperately needed to use the safe for our belongings because the place made you feel that unsafe, however, it did not work. The drains in the sink, as well as the shower, were clogged causing them to fill with water within seconds after turning the faucets on. After our stay, I noticed that the credit card I used was charged $359.88 TWICE!!!! I won't even get into the problems this created for me having to contact the bank and the hotel multiple times. When I spoke to the front desk I was informed that our stay was actually $260 NOT $160. When I complained about this price I was asked why I didn't mention any problems sooner. I explained to the rep that I was told a deposit would be held on the card and assumed it was a $200 deposit based on the fact I was told BEFORE I booked the stay that my total would be roughly $160. Pictures displayed online are just sticker posters on a wall inside a very very small room. Nothing was resolved & I'm sure this review may not post because it is so negative.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: NHLPrincess
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was good. The hotel staff was wonderful. There is absolutley NO counter space in the bathroom....at least not in the room we stayed in. I was not expecting this to be a "motel" type property in that each room enterance was outside. I was a bit nervous at first,, but was surprised once in the room. Bathtub/shower was very slippery - could potentially be dangerous for some. Overall rating - 7 Only reason I would not stay there again is that it was a bit far from the Gaslamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Free Breakfast if you book online. A little facelift would make this place awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JG104
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The lobby is really cute - small / boutique style. The rooms don't reflect this though. If you are not going to be in your room very much, this place will do. We booked online and got a free breakfast every morning, which was really good. The restaurant, like the rest of the hotel, needs some work though. The views are beautiful, but the neat lanterns that hang from the ceiling are covered in dust and paint was chipping from the chairs. The rooms and the rest of the hotel are this way too. If every room looked the way it does online, (with a large, retro photo on the wall) this place would be awesome. It was a disappointment to walk in my room and not see that. The rooftop was great. We got a drink at the restaurant and took it up there to watch the sunset over the bay. It was beautiful. The staff was pretty friendly and you can't beat the location. An overall facelift would make this place perfect. I must say, if I was planning another trip to San Diego, I would book at this hotel because the price is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: mpirate
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Diego and had to make a last minute change in our accomodations. The Porto Vista had no problem getting us a room on a Frday afternoon. The room was very clean, had a balcony, the bed was VERY comfortable and was reasonably priced. The staff made every effort to see that we were comfortable, even though there was a wedding that same weekend in the hotel. When we visit San Diego again, we will definately be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ScientistIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in May. My boyfriend and I were looking for a lower to mid-range priced hotel close enough to the san diego convention center. This hotel is a pleasant walk to the convention center. Its lovely because you can walk down the coastline which is beautiful and you have the opportunity to do some sight-seeing along the way. Its in close proximity to the italian restaurants and the main strip of san diego. The hotel had a shuttle bus which took us and collected us from san diego zoo. The hotel staff are lovely. The lobby is very tasfully decorated. There is a nice roof top restaurant which serves food and drinks. Now we did find the staff at the restaurant totally incompetent during our stay the service was dire and took forever! I hope they have new management or new staff! I do remember that. It was nice to have the hottube to use for a dip in the evenings. Our room was nice and comfortable not huge but fine. I have to say for the price and location i would definitely think of staying here again and i would recommend it to people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dburroughs76
Reviews.Content: While the Hotel itself could use a little updating and repair, it sits at the heart of Little Italy in San Diego. The murals on the walls are unique and the Customer Service is by far the best I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “This place is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dickmarticp
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was so friendly and helpful - especially Joaquim. It is in the middle of Little Italy and you wake each morning to out of this world aromas. If you're there on a Saturday be sure to go to the Farmer's Market down the street. You really get your money's worth with reasonable rates and free breakfast from their great restaurant's menu. Only slight problem was that there wasn't enough space to store your personal items in the bathroom. We will definitely return to to this warm and hip place.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice I could have made!”
Reviews.Author: sweetee_314
Reviews.Content: Celebrating my birthday I had done my research and the Porto Vista Hotel not only had a great price, but a unique atmosphere. Upon arrival, the staff exceeded all my expectations! They upgraded our room, were extremely friendly, and recommended an exquisite restaurant that turned into a fabulous club. They even went so far to hook us up with reservations just 30 min before we headed out. Had a GREAT experience! Would definitely go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel....beware!”
Reviews.Author: Jenandryan
Reviews.Content: Have reasonable expectations and don't be fooled by pictures and website description. This was formerly a motel 6 and for all intent and purposes still is with a different name! If this is what your looking for you will be just fine. The stained carpet outdoor hallways bring back scary memories of childhood road trips to grandmas where mom and dad put the fam up for the night for $19.99 with a free breakfast. The "queen" bed is the size of a slightly oversized twin, barely big enough for one, however, if you like an extremely intimate night of sleep with you partner on a slate mattress with paper like sheets you may enjoy this and even consider it a feature. Privacy, not here, however, if you are really into eaves dropping and possibly PI work, this is your spot as you can hear everything from a toilet flush in the next room to the homeless man sleeping outside your door snoring. Again, I want to be clear, as this is a negative for me and my partner, this could again be a feature or positive for you and yours. In summary this is a motel, not to be confused with a hotel, if you like the features described above enjoy your stay, if not be warned

Reviews.Title: “Really awesome hotel, with one annoying exception”
Reviews.Author: Vik_travel
Reviews.Content: I just want to get the one "negative" aspect of this hotel out of the way - which really annoyed me for this otherwise fantastic hotel. On Saturday (my first morning at the hotel), the cleaning lady knocked at my door around 9am and asked if I wanted my room serviced. I said no, as I had just woke up. She then asked me if I needed any shampoo/soap or whatever, I declined, and she left. But I didn't think that was it! My room wasn't cleaned at all for the day, since I guess they didn't bother to come back. Seriously - I don't know about other people, but 9am on a Saturday is pretty darn early to be asking someone if they want their room to be serviced. I assume housekeeping just wanted to finish their stuff early for the day or something, but it's pretty unacceptable the way this was done. Granted, it's really not a big deal in the grand scheme of things, but it just irked me that housekeeping would wake someone up early, and then not even bother to show up again. BUT - now that I've vented, there are some great things about this hotel (I swear): +Location: Right in the middle of "Little Italy", the location is pretty awesome for San Diego. Close to the waterfront, a 5 minute walk from the trolley (which will get you around town), and of course Little Italy is a pretty neat place in itself +Clean & spacious rooms: Other than the above, the room itself was very clean and well maintained. Clean bedding, very clean washroom and properly dusted/vacuumed. The rooms were very decent sized as well, especially the bathroom which was quite spacious +WiFi/other services: The wireless at the hotel was really strong; it seems like they have a separate network for each floor, which means a stronger signal for guests. In addition, the shuttle service was great as well - the guy who picked me up from the airport was super nice and friendly, and gave some great info/tips on San Diego. Definitely a good way to start off the trip. Unfortunately I didn't get to eat the Porto Vista, but everyone raves about their restaurant, so I think it's definitely worth checking out if you can. +Quiet: Some people mentioned that it was noisy due to the nearby airport. Personally, I didn't hear any excessive noise (and my window was open). A little tip would be to turn on the (very good) fan/AC to get some white noise while you sleep. Some other things to note: -Not a big deal, but the TV sets in the hotel room were really old and fuzzy - it seemed like I was going back in time when I turned on the TV. Granted, I probably only watched 30 minutes during my entire stay, but still something that should be updated ASAP (in my opinion) -The "motel" vibe: From the outside, the Porto Vista looks like a "hotel". But once you go up the elevator to your floor, you get more of a "motel" feel (you can check out my pics to see what I'm talking about). It's not really a big deal, and really had no impact on my stay either way, but just something to keep in mind. -The fifth floor: I stayed on the fifth floor, and it was pretty silent. However, I would point out that they seem to have a pretty large outdoor lounge/sitting area on the 5th floor, so if there's parties or whatever going on there at night, I would imagine it gets pretty loud. I'd suggest getting a room on another floor just in case. Apart from the annoyance with the housekeeping staff, this is a pretty good hotel to pick if you're in San Diego. Great location, nice staff (apart from housekeeping I guess), clean, quiet, and generally a good value (I got an amazing price on bookit.com - $55/night). This isn't a luxury hotel by any means - it's pretty no-frills, with basic amenities. But it does its job and gives you a comfortable place to rest while you're in town. Would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, but let's just hope housekeeping is a little less "annoying" in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find”
Reviews.Author: calcoast75
Reviews.Content: It's very close to the airport and it had a better price than the comparable hotels in the downtown area. The free breakfast was more gourmet than the typical free hotel breakfast and the service was excellent. If I had to mention a negative, the pillow was a little too soft for my tastes, but it was easily remedied by using a towel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: etapngav
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on the reviews and location. I was very happy with the room and the friendly staff. The location was walking distance from downtown and in the center of Little Italy. The free breakfast was very good. On the weekends, the happy hour starts at noon. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good rooms, quality food”
Reviews.Author: GeoffWhere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fabulous renovation of a once tired, old-style 'motel' that's now well and truly above any former glory days it might have seen in long past lives. Brilliant location, comfortable rooms with quality bedding, good shower, high grade meeting rooms, great food - one of the best steaks I've ever had, anywhere, good breakfast and coffee (although a slightly limited menu, the limited choice obviously adds to the value equation and, with Little Italy just around the corner, it doesn't matter!). Only a few blocks walk to downtown and the Star of India, etc, close to the Interstate 5 and the airport, it's a gem that will definitely get my business next time I visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!”
Reviews.Author: ipapyrus
Reviews.Content: Our stay was pleasant! We chose it for its proximity to both the zoo and Little Italy. We did not expect the GORGEOUS view of the marina!!! It's 1 block from most of Little Italy's delightful restaurants and a 10 minute drive from the zoo. Another thing we didn't expect was a photo of a model blown up on a wall in the room. It was kind of creepy but it made sense with the rest of the hotel. Super clean room, super comfy bed (mattress was firm like we prefer--if you like soft, make sure you ask) and the staff was a joy. One quick note: no free parking. Valet was kind of pricey but it beat parking on a street that was scheduled to be swept overnight (fine or towing if parked apparently). Overall, this was an excellent stay. I plan to stay here again when we visit SD again!

Reviews.Title: “Great low-cost stay with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkeyVermont
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed in the hotel for four nights. It was in a perfect location, just a few blocks from the harbor, the Amtrak station, and a bus stop. Very easy to get around. Loved the free full breakfast and the $5 happy hour drinks. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The view from the roof was great. Free shuttle to Balboa Park, zoo, and airport. Very helpful shuttle driver. I returned home saying that San Diego was one of the friendliest cities I've ever stayed in and a lot of that had to do with the Porto Vista! Only one small thing, the motel like design of the place was a little weird--at first I felt uncomfortable with folks walking by our window but we were seldom in our room and I quickly became accustomed to it. Thank you Porto Vista!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: zonacruiser25
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while searching for a hotel and parking for our January cruise. This hotel offered a package with a room and 7 nights parking for a great price. They have recently upgraded most rooms. Ours was clean and spacious and had new bedding. The rate included a hot breakfast for 2 in the restaurant which is also the bar. It has a nice view of San Diego harbor. The hotel also has a nice 5th floor (roof) sitting area where you can enjoy your own happy hour if you choose. The location is walking distance to Gaslamp (less than 1 mile), the harbor and in the middle of all the great dining in Little Italy. The staff was very friendly and anxious to help in any way they could. The parking was included with the room and it was enclosed valet parking with in and out privileges. We have used other hotels close to the cruises port before and Porto Vista is an exceptional value compared to most and much cleaner and more comfortable than several of the other hotels that offer similar pricing for the package. We will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Turbobiker
Reviews.Content: I travel to this hotel at least once a year and up to four times a year. This hotel is within walking distance from everything that I want and has a shuttle service to and from the airport which is very important to me. Their staff is friendly and courteous..

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: WouldBeTraveler19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Porto Vista for one night and moved rooms twice. The first room on the 4th floor smell like cigarettes and wet spots were on the comforter which I would assume was water but I can't denied or confirm that. The comforter itself looked beat up. frayed threads and worn spots made the comforter look really old. Those weren't The reason for moving rooms was 6 teenage girls decided to rent the room next to us to celebrate a birthday party and the parents were nowhere to be found. After listening to screaming and banging for some time I decided to walk over next door and knock on the door and ask politely that the teenage girls to quiet down. The response was "we will try.." Needless to say they didn't try hard enough. I called down to the front desk explained the situation and asked if we could get a different room which they were very accommodating and switched our rooms. The second room was much cleaner and didn't smell like it was previously occupied by a chain smoker. The comforter looked new and the sheets smelled much cleaner. The constant jet landing in the nearby airport and the train horn made sleeping difficult. Also the bathroom lights did not work. I took a desk lamp plugged it into the hallway outlet. and moved it into the bathroom just so I could get some light. Apparently the wiring was messed up. When we checked out they said the reason for the lights not working in the bathroom was because it was an "eco-friendly" room and required us to swipe our key to turn on the lights but all the lights worked in the hotel except the bathroom. Plus there was no key swipe in the room at all. Room 502 had bad wiring it wasn't because it was an eco-friendly room... Some positives are -the location is great for visiting Gaslamp district, San Diego Zoo, and Balboa park. The staff is fairly friendly but may treat you like an idiot. Some people may enjoy that.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjrunner3
Reviews.Content: just driving up to the hotel was a slight disappointment, I didnt even notice it as a hotel if it wasnt for the big banner sign saying the name. it feels like a motel turned hotel, the court yard is a cement parking lot and the rooms are cramped. the furniture was wobbly and slightly broken, the tv scratched and the walls dirty. the bathroom was child size. it looked like some retro furniture to make the multicolored walls less noticeable. the pictures resemble very little of the hotel and i was so disappointed, will not stay here again. the beds and wall mural was the only nice part. the customer service could be nicer and seem more interested in your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikesanfrancisco61
Reviews.Content: I booked 5 nights at this hotel in a junior suite. The pictures on the website do not match the actual room. At checkin the clerk asked me if I had a lot of luggage as the elevator was being repaired. Luckily I had local friends with me to climb to the fifth floor. Arriving at my room we found an elevator next to the room. Also it was rainy heavy and the hotel room entrances are outside and we had to walk from the stairs across two long open walk ways. We were drenched. One, the clerk should have known about the other elevator and offered us an umbrella. Back to the room. The room was very large but the furniture and bathroom looked like an assisted living room. The room was simply ugly and not clean. I returned to the hotel later the same day and asked if there was a room available that was respresented in the web site. The clerk had no idea but throught the suites had the large bathrooms with a separate shower. I returned to the room and tried the heater. The wall heater made noise all night. The comforter was torn and looked dirty. The next morning I checked out the hotel. I moved to the Sheraton Suites. The Sherator was 1000 times better than the Porto Vista and was over $10 a night less expensive with a reward program. Warning - don't stay at this hotel! There are better options in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its BEST - DELIGHTFUL BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: francestal
Reviews.Content: superior deluxe room Delightful huge bathroom - the most com fortable huge bed - romantic setting - from the moment you enter the lobby you are greeted by smiling professional Reception staff...The shuttle service is amazing - they are always there for you with a smile...on the Fourth floor there is a Delightful Bar/restaurant with the happiest staff who make you very welcome...and the view from there is very sspecial. We have a very special thanks to Mo and iphone Michael for making our vacation perfect..no doubt we will be returning very soon,,,First Class I gove this property 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Better then Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: jonkar154
Reviews.Content: We booked this 3 night stay after reviewing it online. There was some "iffy" comments, but I could not figure out why. Hotel was very well located; within easy access to attractions, Harbor, Airport, etc. Staff was very helpful and friendly, particularly the hotel vehicle operator. He was more then willing to assist with any reasonable request, and shared information about the area. Room "package" came with a very good breakfast in the "Glass Door" restaurant each morning (view from restaurant is extremely lovely). Many nice places to visit or eat at within easy walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An extremely friendly staff that will never disappoint you!”
Reviews.Author: Half_a_Century
Reviews.Content: We called the hotel from the airport and shortly thereafter we were picked up by the most friendly and courteous shuttle driver. As we checked in the front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful ... they were awesome... always ready to answer any question or help in whatever way they could. The staff in the dining room was amazing. The view from our room was great and the availablility to all the sites either by foot, shuttle or taxi allowed us to be always on time for our meetings each day. The area offers great food at a variety of pricing and experiences. We honestly couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Must see city”
Reviews.Author: mollybgood
Reviews.Content: Perfect weather, very friendly, helpful people, what a great experience. We stayed at the Porta Vista Hotel in Little Italy section of San Diego. It was convenient to eating and touring. They have a FREE shuttle to most of the local attractions for tourists. Shuttle to and from the airport, again FREE. Beautiful view of the harbor. The staff was very helpful, numerous times. Would stay here again tomorrow!!

Reviews.Title: “Small Town Feel, Great for short trips”
Reviews.Author: deborah_na08
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my boyfriend and I visited San Diego, and with a rocky beginning to our trip, the hotel staff made us truly feel welcome all the way from the front desk personnel to the valet guy/service. If you want to visit San Diego on a budget, but still want a cozy, eclectic, & non-traditional hotel stay, I highly recommend the Porto Vista!! For the price, it was well worth it and well put together! Bathrooms were clean, which were important for me, and although the room was a standard it still had a comfortable bed and all the necessary necessities. Location! Location! Location! ABSOLUTELY AMAZINGLY PERFECT Location! It's nestled in the heart of "Little Italy" in San Diego, minutes from Downtown and all the great bars & restaurants, and LIttle Italy offers the greatest Italian pizzas and pastas and wine along with art galleries and little shops! The only two flaws about the hotel were the room card situation, sometimes the magnetic card swipe would stop working and we'd have to go down replace it, and it's not the fanciest hotel offering the highest quality amenities such as a flatscreen tv, or jacuzzi tub...but if you don't need extravagent, but cozy, its the perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Had I known...I would have Upgraded sooner!”
Reviews.Author: JustGiveMeTheLight
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I was attending a seminar in Downtown San Diego. From the looks of the website and the style of the hotel, I was pretty excited about my stay. It is located in a great part of town called Little Italy and it was very accessible to public transportation. I traveled late from LA to SD on a Monday and arrived at about 1 AM. The gentleman at the front desk was very helpful and directed me to my room. I did not book my own room, my company did, and was very grateful for that, until I entered my new space for the next 4 days. I was given a room on the 1st floor where the view out of my window was a parking lot. The room was tiny, the sitting chair was placed in front of the closet cabinet doors (because there was no where else to put it), and the light in my bathroom did not work. Too tired to complain, I went to sleep. The next morning, I let the front desk know about the light and they had fixed it by the time I returned in the afternoon. I spent 3 more nights in this single Queen room. My friend decided to come down and visit for the weekend, so I wanted to extend my stay in San Diego. I went and asked if there were any available rooms, possibly a King, for Friday night. Luckily, there was one available (even though there were 3 wedding parties arriving), and they kindly set me up. I walked back to my little cave and decided to walk right back out and ask if a King was available right then and how much more it was. I found out it was only $15 to upgrade and began my move up to the 5th floor (the highest level). I took the elevator and, as I exited, I caught the end of a beautiful SD sunset on the ocean. The King was nearly twice the size of the queen and I had a balcony with a partial view of the ocean. The next 2 night were soooo much better (although they do need to do an upgrade on their TVs....the one in the queen didn't even have a remote control!). If I had known the size and price difference between a Queen and a King, I would have upgraded to the bigger room sooner! My stay there, all in all, was still enjoyable. The location was incredible, the prices were reasonable, and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: nicblue78
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is in a fantastic neighborhood. We walked everywhere. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from downtown San Diego, or a $5 cab ride. -Little Italy is quaint, quiet and has tons of great restaurants. -The hotel shuttle is quick and convenient. The view of the bay from the hotel restaurant is wonderful. -The hotel staff is attentive and we received fantastic customer service our entire stay. Cons: -The inside of the hotel has a motel feel as the hallways are open to the outdoors, and they need a fresh paint job. -The rooms are small, but nicely decorated and the beds are comfortable. -The bathroom itself was a bit out of date. -We would definitely return to the hotel because of the neighborhood and great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: MarkG_LA
Reviews.Content: THE BEST HOTEL IN SAN DIEGO FOR THE RATE. The place is clean. the rooms are very nice and the bed ARE THE BEST. The staff are great and friendly. Only thing it needs is a pool. But ITS IN THE PERFECT LOCATION. The surrounding area "Little Italy" the best in San Diego. You can just go for a walk and find the best shops, FOOD and NICE BARS. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, petit and great comfort...”
Reviews.Author: Jers79
Reviews.Content: Everything was more that I expected. Great time in San Diego. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: 5scheidemona
Reviews.Content: This most recent stay at Porto Vista Hotel was truly excellent. Every last detail (room, parking, dinner reservations, etc) was attended with care and professionalism. Everything was truly top-shelf, from the friendly greeting at the parking area, the check-in (the staff offered to check our bags directly to our room in since we arrived early - we accepted, of course), the room service, dinner and breakfast at the Glass Door. The first evening, the Glass Door restaurant served us an excellent light dinner (we went 'tapas' since we'd nibbled at a couple of other places earlier in the day) and a great breakfast the next morning. The views from their deck are tremendous! Even on a cold evening as ours, the heated patio was comfortable and full of people enjoying the environment. The proximity to India Street restaurants, cafes, and wine bars are another plus to this wonderful hotel, btw. Our sleep was perfect: a big warm bed in a beautiful room without any noise at all from other guests or the street. To have your fist coffee of the morning on the suite's long balcony with inspiring views of the sunrise over the marina is another definite plus! Our check-out was as seamless as our check-in. Two words: excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JoPLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the hotel. I like the vibe of it, the restaurant, great food,and the terrace (the views are great). The bed and pillows were very comfortable, but the bathroom was very small, with no room to put toiletries. The TV was old and didn't have a good picture..hint to manager..get new TV's. We stayed 2 nights and on the second day, the bed was not made, just the bedcover was straightened up, I had to remake the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lvickl53
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after seeing the photos and reading the good reviews, then realized I should have read the bad reviews to. A day before the trip, I read the reviews, and was very disappointed so I contacted the Hotel let a message with no one responding. So I went onto booking which did such a fast job I asked if they could place my partner and I in a room with clean carpet and newer side of the hotel. It's seriously like a motel. Through booking they were able to contact Ryan, and he noted on our account to put it us in the newer side of the building in a Business King Deluxe (i guess that's with the balcony), I had called early the morning of our arrival to say please don't give the room away we're arriving at 10pm, receptionist responded ok. We get there, our room was sold out so you get two queen beds. (ok there's nothing we can do now so ok we took the room) after we got the keys, we went to the room the light doesn't work on the main wall. And then there was a dirty red straw on the comforter of one of the beds. So I go back down and ask if the room was cleaned and why the light doesn't work, gave me excuses and then asked if i wanted to change my room. So I said yes please, changed to a room bigger and better, that room was ok, but the bathroom had mildew in the shower on the tiles. gross. Although the complimentary breakfast was pretty good in their restaurant on the 4th floor. weird though because through booking.com we got complimentary breakfast, and the receptionist that night gave us tickets, but as we were checking out early this morning Ryan said we didn't qualify for the breakfast. THIS PLACE IS ALL OVER THE PLACE. ridiculous the staff, the booking, i don't know what more to say but to not stay here. I read the great reviews and was so excited but really it's ridiculous. oh and the remote to my tv didn't have batteries, by then I was just too exhausted to even bother calling for a battery.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MomaD514
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, would recommend this hotel to everyone. We arrived a bit early and instead of making us wait they upgraded us to a jr. suite, since none of the rooms we rented were available. The hotel was cute and quiet and the staff was friendly and eager to help. Loved the views from the hotel and is in immediate walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location...great holiday”
Reviews.Author: gig16
Reviews.Content: Porto Vista hotel is in such a central location for seeing the sights of San Diego. It's shuttle bus (which I wasn't aware would pick me up from the hotel had I rung them) was a bonus in visiting Sea World & Balboa Park. My room was clean, and very adequate as a base for travel. The planes were a bit annoying, they're loud and easily heard in the room - but I got use to them. Breakfast was a great bonus - and very yummy. The restaurant is a great place for a drink to enjoy the view, but the dinner prices were a bit steep for what was served. Female staff were more than helpful - males behind the front desk needed a shake up - were of little help

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Penumbra87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the suites in October. The hotel is very pleasant, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay very much. The suite costs more than a regular room by about $40/night but it was well worth it because we had a living room and a balcony overlooking the bay. It was still cheaper than most hotels in the area. The restaurant upstairs is a good deal (you pay $35 to get a $50 meal) and good food. Breakfast is free if you book online through their site. The hotel shuttle will take you pretty much everywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disregard bad reviews... This place was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: CNAO
Reviews.Content: We live here in La Jolla and I wanted to take my wife and 3 month old downtown for the Italian FESTA as well as get away for a "staycation" on our Anniversary. I read the reviews and reluctantly went with the PV to make my own opinion. Being that we are close I would have just come home if it were bad. It was the exact opposite. Very friendly staff, GREAT breakfast for FREE, and we walked all over downtown, Seaport Village, and Little Italy without a single issue. The price is surprisingly low for the location, free shuttle to Sea World and Zoo, and the food in Little Italy is superb! You only have to walk one block to get to it. The room was a King w/balcony. Plenty of room for us, the stroller, and the baby's Pack-n-Play. The fridge, microwave, and wet bar proved handy too. There is not another REAL Hotel Downtown offering so much for it's guests at this price. I will summarize by saying, make your own opinion by going here, we did and it paid off big time. GREAT PLACE and I would go again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy cos was put off by reviews”
Reviews.Author: SineadO
Reviews.Content: I often am surprised at the negativity of some reviews of hotels and I'm happy to say that this hotel is lovely. Yes there's airplanes flying by but that's hard to avoid downtown San Diego, the rooms are soundproofed enough it's not a problem. Staff were very helpful at check in, changed our room to a partial ocean view even though fully booked for a wedding party weekend and the room itself is clean, comfy bed and a great deal for the price. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: LagunaBeachMarylynn
Reviews.Content: We were there for the Little Italy Festival and the hotel was very close, but the rooms are very small and old.We were on the fourth floor and a wedding reciption was going on above us. Very noisey. Then as for our free breakfast it was awful Food was cold and the potatoes were from the day before or at least they seemed that way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: kimkilkenny
Reviews.Content: When our son and Daughter-in-law decided to select PV as their wedding headquarters this past spring, we were excited because we were already fans of the Glass Door Restaurant for it's views and great munchies. It was a marvelous hotel for my 5 brothers, 5 sisters and their families to rendezvous during the weekend of festivities. The staff was extremely helpful, the breakfasts and happy hours were well staffed and the housekeeping staff took wonderful care of our entire party with extra towels and sprucing whenever we requested it! We took full advantage of the patio areas and location in the heart of Little Italy and walkable San Diego attractions and nightlife. The evening roof top reception, after the wedding, was great fun with an unparalleled view of the sunset over San Diego Bay. Did I say great staff? They were terrific. We will definitely return for quiet weekends and group functions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but noisy surroundings from the freeway behind.”
Reviews.Author: GlenB062
Reviews.Content: Very good customer service, location, breakfasts and rooms. Did have a problem with highway noise from the freeway and being a weekend, a party happening next door. Booked a shuttle to the Airport and they were 20 minutes late starting the run which left us dashing at the last minute for our plane.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MaryK090
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Porto Vista for 3 nights. For the price we paid, it was a fantastic value! The room was standard (the décor wasn’t really chic as advertised) with a comfortable bed. The oldest thing about the room was the tiny 15 yr old TV, which didn’t even work. We had free full breakfast at the restaurant upstairs included in the price (up to $12, and you can choose from a menu), which was fantastic. The restaurant itself had a terrace with a view of the city. The hotel also has an enormous rooftop lounge that offers great views of the city. The only parking available was valet, at $14 a day, but considering how expensive the parking was everywhere in San Diego, that was a good price. There were unlimited in/out privileges, and the parking attendants were all very friendly and gave us directions to anywhere we needed to go. Not really close to anything by foot. About a 20 minute walk to the Gaslamp quarter. Parking was insanely expensive there (and hard to find), so we took a cab instead, which only cost $5. Parking tip: Park at the Horton Westfield Plaza if you’re going to shop or going to the Gaslamp Quarter. If you go into the mall and validate your ticket at any of the machines (no purchase necessary), you get 3 hours free parking, even after mall hours (as long as you’ve validated before closing). Make sure not to be late because after that it’s 2$ for every 15 minutes (no maximum)!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel so far on our holiday and the most expensive”
Reviews.Author: 60750Chris
Reviews.Content: The smallest rooms in USA we think. First room dirty then changed to another but both rooms tiny. No fresh air as windows could not be opened. Didn't feel secure - the lock on bedroom door had been forced by previous guests. No fridge in room so forced to use tap water for drinking. Location a good miles walk from any nightlife/restaurants. Not at all in the centre of attractions as advertised. Didn't sleep well as could hear plumbing from neighbouring rooms, trains and planes flying low overhead. In all totally disatisfield and wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough”
Reviews.Author: ChilliLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Wed 15th Sept for 3 nights. I had pre-paid on expedia, but was not made aware of the valet parking, that you have to use at $14 per day, which was a little cheeky as there is no where else you can park, we were in and out a fair bit so with tips everytime they get your car your looking at an extra $30 or so. The hotel itself was nice enough, clean, comfortable rooms, and nice bathroom. We were on the top floor so had no view unless we went outside. The breakfast was really good I must say and served in a nice little restaurant with outside heated seating, this was inclusive of our cost. It is in a fairly good location, close to the airport, little Italy and about a $7 cab ride to the gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Very decieving website”
Reviews.Author: asrath
Reviews.Content: First off their website does not portray this place accurately. The website shows nice blue trendy rooms. What we received looked like a updated Super 8. When we checked in, which was after the check in time, the front desk employee made a comment under her breath about our room not being ready. She made some calls and we were handed a key and sent on our way. No explanation of anything or "Have a nice stay." When we found our room after waiting at the elevator for 10 minutes we realized it wasn't the room we reserved. It looked like an upgrade to a suite as it was much larger, but that was the only thing it had going for it. The room was large, but the furniture was mismatched and old looking. The mini fridge under the counter didn't work. All it did was flicker its light and it didn't cool at all. The sink in the "kitchenette" wobbled as it wasn't installed properly. The TV was actually a flat screen but it was way too small for the large room. The room was painted a nasty yellow color with gross green carpet. Nothing like the cool blue rooms on the website. There were numbers written on the wall that looked like they tried to scrub off, but didn't care enough to repaint. The bathroom looked like it was remodeled by a child. The tile floor was uneven, the toilet was tightened down so it also wobbled. The sink vanity was crooked on the wall and none of it lined up with the mirror or light. The tilling around the tub was a hack job and the shower was so badly installed that they had to the fill the large cracks between the wall and the surround with caulking. The bed was comfortable but the sheets weren't fitted. They just took one sheet and laid it across the bed. None of the towels matched. Some looked like old used pool towels because they had a blue tint to them. I could have sworn the website mentioned a pool when I reserved but none was found. When we checked in we received tokens for free breakfast during our stay. This was nice since there aren't many breakfast restaurants around. We ate there three days and the food got perpetually better. This isn't much of an accomplishment considering how it started, The first day we ate at 9 and all the food was cold like it had been sitting out all morning. The next day my eggs were at least warm and by the third day it was all warm. The waitress that helped us two of the days was actually very good and friendly. If it hadn't been free I would have complained. The valet prices were a little high but I didn't mind the 14 dollars a day because the parking situation in Little Italy wasn't very good. The valets were some of the best employees at the place so I didn't mind too much. The location is good if you like Italian food. Which we do. The proximity to Little Italy was great. It was just a one block walk to dinner every night and the local cafe. Mimmos and Filippi's were wonderful restaurants. The location close to the harbor, zoo, and Sea World were also pluses as those were the main attractions we wanted to see. The main thing they need to work on is their customer service. They had a couple excellent employees but overall the rest of the place needs some help. The website also needs to be truthfully updated.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: KATS06
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and had none of the problems others listed. Reserved a deluxe double queen room. Room was nicely appointed and the beds were very comfortable. I think I slept better than I have ever slept in a hotel but we had also been sailing all day. We were on the top floor (5). No view but we were just staying one night and were spending time at the hotel for sleep only. The hallways to the rooms are open air and there is a roof top deck on the 5th floor for events. So I guess if a wedding reception took place there, it could be very noisy. A block away is Little Italy so we wandered there for both dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good service, shuttles a plus. amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Bean_sunshine
Reviews.Content: stayed here while seeing the zoo and seaworld. free shuttles to both! complimentary breakfast was beyond what i expected. try the french toast! i had it every morning and cant stop thinking about it. quick walk to little Italy, great food down there good view from restaurant of the water. rooms a bit small, but we were out most of the day so just came home to crash therefore got the job done. good coffee in room and amazing in the restaurant. popular night club upstairs, so just dont get one of the top floors (as far as the reviews for noise complaints). we stayed on the 2nd and didnt hear a thing safe neighborhood too as far as i could tell. we walked every night to little italy and never felt uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Booked just for fun but would totally stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: nice2meetU
Reviews.Content: Since we were in town for a wedding without the kids, I decided to live a little on the edge and book a night at the PV. The website is a lot swankier than the actual property but I still enjoyed our room, the restaurant, and the views of the Little Italy and the bay. We got a great rate booking directly with the hotel and free breakfast, which was excellent! Afterwards we checked out the Little Italy Mercato/Farmer's Market just a few blocks down the street. It's a foodie haven to die for - Saturdays 9-3pm. There's also free morning yoga available on certain days and a rooftop bar that shuts down at midnight. We did happen to hear people making a raucus as we were trying to go to sleep but it seems they were just making their way to their rooms or something because it didn't last very long. Other than that we were able to sleep pretty soundly in the super comfy bed, which is the most important part of the hotel stay for me. For a little over $130, tax and parking included, it was the perfect experience and we'd totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “TWO STARS .... AT BEST”
Reviews.Author: schrisanderson
Reviews.Content: The Porto Vista Hotel is located in the 'Little Italy' section of San Diego, a quaint shopping and dining district. From an aerial view, the hotel is shaped like an open, square box with a separation wall down the middle, thus having two 'atriums' separated and surrounded by rooms on all sides. The lobby is attractive and the desk personnel were professional, personable and, to the extent allowed by the hotel's problems, very helpful. Two elevators are available - one extremely slow and noisy (doors needed lubricated), and the other remote and available only after climbing a flight of stairs (odd?). The hotel offered NO swimming pool, NO hottub, NO refrigerator, NO microwave, NOT even a pen or pad of paper. They took out the pool some time ago and replaced it with a meeting room that remained completely empty during our stay (no tables, no chairs, no anything). The hallways were covered with disgustingly stained carpet (except for the 5th floor concrete hallways) and lined with air conditioning units jutting out into the small hallway about 12 inches and many of these were rusting and in need of paint. The two 'atriums' did NOT overlook attractively landscaped courtyards but badly stained concrete parking areas. Parking was by valet only at a cost of $14 a day unless you wished to park on the busy street with various parking limitations. The Porto Vista is about 3 miles from the renowned San Diego Zoo and the primary reason we stayed here. There is a small rooftop viewing area that allows a nice view of the surroundings as well as the incoming and outgoing airport flights which fly overhead nearby. The beds are comfortable but squeaky, awakening sleepers in the room. The hutch and armoire dominate the small room, standing six feet tall and offering very little horizontal space and they dwarf the 21" TV. The bathroom was adequate but the ceiling was peeling and rusty in places. Upon arrival, there was a large pool of water on the sink, perhaps from a leaking faucet, and the toilet required that the handle be held down until the full flushing process was complete. Lamps had switches on cords hanging behind furniture (difficult to see or use). The rooms were austere, completely lacking decoration other than the tasteless black-and-white whole wall depiction of a movie star. The room air-conditioner was effective and moderately quiet. Every footstep of the tenant above our room was heard. Cars honked their horns in the 'atrium' outside our door and the blasts echoed and reverberated loudly. Other than the small rooftop viewing area, the remainder of the rooftop was adorned with an open area lined with attractive seating, but all of this was behind a large padlocked gate unavailable to guests except at times undetermined and unmarked (no signs explaining when it was open). The 'Glass Door', the hotel bar overlooking "Little Italy" appeared to be nice and the happy hour and dinner menus were adequate. There was NO complimentary breakfast of any sort. I was informed that because I had phoned the hotel directly and made my own reservation, I did NOT 'qualify' for any such consideration. Huh? However, this was conveyed very politely and with an apology (what the management puts their staff through amazes me). Again, the staff were always gracious, what what they have to work with is appalling. Imagine in this day and age, a lodging establishment in a major city with NO pool, NO hottub, No refrigerator, NO microwave, NO complimentary breakfast. Other negatives were the seedy-looking hallways and atriums and bland rooms. We have stayed at hundreds of hotels include the Porto Vista as one of the BOTTOM TWO hotels we've experienced. The ONLY reasons this hotel rates even the one-star is because of location and a great staff. We overheard comments of other guests, especially on the elevator, saying that they felt 'trapped in this dump', because if they left, the 24-hour cancellation policy would require the loss of one night's room cost. We inderstood. In final review, other than the excellent staff and good location, this hotel is of VERY POOR quality and we would NEVER stay here again. Thank you for allowing me to offer these observations.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth my money”
Reviews.Author: whateverps
Reviews.Content: •When booking the hotel I was told the hotel had a pool. When arriving, no pool could be found. •When arriving they had a $14 fee for parking. I was not informed of this fee by internet advertisement, email of confirmation or when calling in to make the reservations •While staying in the room our small TV only got 3 channels and not suitable for children to watch. •The room had not bath tub, which I had asked if they had when making the reservations. But instead a shower, which did not drain at all!!! I called down to the front desk that night to inform them. They said they would call me back and I never got a call back. So water was everywhere when all 5 of us to showers! Bottom line, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Has potential but fails at the basics”
Reviews.Author: Nigel1127
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to the Porto Vista. Their site made it seem like a great place. The problems started at check-in. It was busy, but one of the three front desk attendees was just going through paperwork and not assisting anyone. She was trained at the front desk job because she helped the guy that checked me in. So it's not like she couldn't have helped check folks in. I observed the other two to be rude to the people that they were checking in. Certainly no "welcome - can I help you" - lots of eye rolling. Very odd. So my first opinion wasn't great. When it was my turn, they printed out my info and the price on it was not the price that I'd gotten on their own website. I noted that in writing, showed the print-out email from THEM that I'd received, and spoke with another attendant and she said it was fixed. But the next day when I checked out, it was still wrong and another supervisor had to fix it. 5 hours after checking in, a pre-ordered item (offered on their own website) had not arrived in my room so I mentioned it when leaving for dinner. I had the print-out from the website and an email where I had corresponded with the hotel about the item. After trying to get me to do it, the front desk attendants finally said that they'd take care of it while I was out (my suggestion, not their offer to help). Upon returning to my room, it still wasn't there. Finally someone from the bar arrived with the wrong item, saying that they didn't know what I was talking about, asking me to pay double what I was quoted on their website for the wrong thing, and lots more eye-rolling. I think they must teach this at Porto Vista orientation because it runs rampant. The room was a king suite. It was a good size and the bed was very nice - slept well. But otherwise, it was pretty shabby actually - some new and some old stuff. Carpet was very shabby. The bathroom seemed nice at first glance but the toilet was wobbly, the soap dish spun around, and the shower control panel also was loose. Breakfast - very average. The toast was so hard the first time 'round that we banged it on the table when the waitress came by to show her it's rocklike features. Check out time is 11am. The maid knocked and entered at 10am thinking we were already gone. What??? Also, there was NOTHING in the room about the hotel. No info on the restaurant, what else was there, not even a pen. Communication is not the best apparently at the Porto Vista - between employees, between employees and the website, and between employees and their customers. Basically, just an odd stay. Maybe they'll get better, but for now, go elsewhere. I will say, that even though we had to pay $14 for the valet parking, the Valets WERE the most customer oriented of the bunch. They were friendly, fast, and knowledgeable about the area. We got concierge type info from them and NOT the front desk folks. All in all. It should have been MUCH better for the money. Their website seems to boast a much better place than it is. But I might be willing to accept a less than perfect building and furniture if the employees were a little more (no, they need to be MUCH more) customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Liars and Thieves”
Reviews.Author: dopo2010
Reviews.Content: My party of 6 arrived with confirmation number in hand for 3 deluxe King w/balcony rooms. We had double-checked with the hotel 3 days earlier when we started out by car and the front desk confirmed our reservation. We arrived road weary the first night and were told that they had only one of the rooms we reserved, the other two being the “cozy queen.” "Cozy” is an understatement. 2 suitcases and 2 men couldn’t walk around the room. One person would have to stay on the bed to let the other move to and from the bathroom. THERE IS A REASON THE ROOM PICTURE ON THE WEBSITE IS OF THE CORNER OF THE ROOM. We repeatedly asked for a manager and were told none were available in person or by telephone and concessions could not be made with out the approval of a manager. We were concerned that the last arriving couple was not going to be able to fit in such tight conditions as he was 6'4 and 270 and needed a king bed to be comfortable let alone fit his wife. Despite much pleading and complaining about how we had confirmed, we were told they couldn’t accommodate. We went to the car and searched another hotel nearby that had kings and went in to cancel the reservation and magically they had a room the third part of our party could have at no additional charge. If we could just be patient and accept the upgrade to a suite, all would be made good in the morning when a manager was available to discuss concessions. The next morning we were made to feel like we were granted the privilege of having our reservations honored but no apology was forthcoming for the terrible room that we had stayed in and for having to wake up extra early to have time to deal with the hotel management. Mr. Johnson, the front desk manager, told us that we would all be comp'd the parking expenditures for the poor customer service we had received and that the third couple would be "allowed" to stay in the suite for the remainder of the stay. During the stay the rooms were not well cleaned and refreshed, one room didn’t get toilet paper restocked and we had to call and get some brought to us. After 3 calls, an extra roll was donated from another room. The extra toilet paper was eventually delivered to the wrong room. The mirrors would fog from the shower and reveal pornographic images left by a previous guest; the refrigerators would not cool anything to below 57 degrees. You could not drink the complimentary coffee in the room because there were no cups in one room and only decaf another. The TV's were a different brand and size in each room, all circa 2000, no flat screens, no digital reception and the color tint function was broken in our room so we watched TV in blue and orange. Breakfast was included with the stay but if you slept past 8am there was no French toast, bacon or sausage. They bill themselves as a "Hip Hotel near Sea World | Zoo"...anyone paying attention to anything "hip" knows you better have bacon. This all culminated in a phone call from Mr. Johnson to my cell phone after leaving and 80 miles out of town telling us that it turns out since one of our party got the room they wanted, no one would be compensated for that first night and parking charges were added to two of our credit cards. DONT STAY HERE unless you want to pay good money for a renovated broken down motor lodge, right off the loud freeway, directly under the flight path of landing jets to the San Diego airport and the worst customer service. They fail to realize that it’s not about the money; it’s about customer service and being played by management.

Reviews.Title: “Not the right vibe.”
Reviews.Author: Medic129
Reviews.Content: I am not in the habit of writing reviews, but the Porto Vista has inspired me. First of all, the website touts a “sexy European style…the Porto Vista Hotel calls to mind the cool, casual mood of the 1960’s Mediterranean coast.” Nope, not even close. It is a poorly renovated motor lodge. Cheesy wall-sized photos and colorful banners over the interior parking lot did not create that trendy retro vibe for me. Poor construction, cheap furnishings and even worse up-keep make this an unpleasant stay. The rooms smelled like mildew, there was a pile of recycling and garbage at the bottom of the dark stairwell and housekeeping was erratic at best. There was a free breakfast that was quite good, but get up very early or it will be gone. “Sorry, we are out of bacon.” But the worst part of all was the customer service from the front desk. Our friends had reserved (pre-paid) 3 rooms for six people- all kings with a balcony, for which we paid extra. When we arrived, my wife and I were the only ones with the king room, the other two being very small queen-sized rooms on the interior. The night desk person did not have the capacity to make a decision without a manager but was able to find a different room for one of the couples after threatening to take our $1200 elsewhere. The next morning, one of the managers offered to our friend to comp all three room’s parking fee at $14 a day for our inconvenience, an offer that we found acceptable. When we checked out, my wife was told that there were no pending charges on our credit card and that a receipt was not necessary. Fine. Later that day our friend received a phone call from the same manager stating that he had changed his mind and that since my wife and I had received the room we had reserved, he was going to charge us for parking after all. The charge showed up on my card today. I attempted to call the general manager but his voicemail box is full and not accepting messages. I have to wonder if it is full of complaints. A call later leads us to another manager who said she would look into the problem. We will see what the outcome of that will be. It is not about the money. It is about customer service. The website lies about the quality of the hotel and the staff will lie to your face.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures Lie”
Reviews.Author: v_naranjo
Reviews.Content: I had never been to San Diego and went for the 4th of july. I was reading reviews here and most seemed so-so and price wise for SD it was reasonable BUT the pictures on the site are nicer than the actual facility. I was disappointed from the $8/day valet to the fridge with NO power cord. The hotel lobby was very open to cold, wind, and traffic noise. They had two elevators but both went to a limited number of floors and took TOO LONG. For the price I expected to have a bell hop, but no I was given a luggage cart and we had to drag up the bags in their cramped OUTDOOR hallways. The bathroom was ok but def not big enough for three girls. And lastly the hotel was secluded with no restaurants or shopping close. **2 out of 5 stars**

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: marina1712
Reviews.Content: Worst place I have ever stayed in my entire life. Terrible and rude employees, dirty rooms. and horrible service. Don't even bother considering to stay here. It's a complete waste of money. They should rename it the hole, cause lets face it it pretty much is from the disgusting rooms right down to the management staff who wouldn't know customer service if it bit them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Porto Vista? We re-named it Porta- Potty”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoFanatiic
Reviews.Content: I really don't know where to start. There were so many things wrong with this hotel (motel?) that it would be hard to describe in the space i have here. Let's start with the elevator...one slow elevator to serve the entire property. Oh by the way, it won't stop on the 2nd floor or the 4th unless you hold the button. We finally figured out that if you don't mind walking past week old garbage you can take the stairs (not clearly marked and i would not recommend a woman taking then alone). Once we finally got to our floor, the carpet in the hallway was absolutely disgusting. I mean, we are talking about 30 year old carpet that has never been cleaned. DO NOT WALK BAREFOOT AROUND THIS HOTEL.. God only knows what kind of disease is in those carpets. The room itself was musty and moldy smelling, and they have window air conditioner from a decade i probably didn't live in. Amazingly, there was no vanity of any kind in the bathroom...you get to set all your toiletries on the floor because there is no where to put them. They claim to have room service, but that's just a rumour...they never actually answer the phone at the front desk. There was not a single brochure, phone book, map, hotel directory, anything, in our room. The biggest issue that i have with this fleabag is the internet pictures of the room...DON"T BELIEVE IT!! They may have one room that looks like the one on the internet, but we had 16 rooms for a wedding and not a single room looked like the one we saw on-line. To be fair, the bed was actually comfortable, and the van driver was great. Overall, what an aweful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dynamite2010
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Porto Vista and were absolutely satisfied. We had a very nice room on the 5th floor, which was clean and big enough. The bathroom was pretty huge, too. The hotel is located in Little Italy, so there a lot of good restaurants there, and Downtown and the Gaslamp District are within walking distance. Negative about this hotel: the free WiFi is extremely slow and the bathroom as a huge glass door, so you don't have any privacy, whatever you're doing, literally.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid any rooms under the restaurant if you want sleep”
Reviews.Author: lcastanon
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from a week long trip to san diego. We stayed in one of the bigger suites of the porto vista hotel with a colleague of mine. We were visiting for Comic Con so the location was a good hike from the convention center but the variety of restaurants in Little Italy made up for it I think. The room itself was spacious, it featured a separate living room with a full size pull out and also a large balcony. The layout of the room is kind of weird, the bathroom door when open blocks the door to the bedroom, so it was kind of awkward. Also for the size of the bathroom they could have added an extra door to it so it could be accessed from the living room without having to go through the bedroom for privacy. The bathroom had separate tub and standing shower which was a nice touch on the other hand. The room felt dated and a bit dirty, the TV in the bedroom is one of those old boxy TV's, and the sliding doors that lead to the balcony looked like they hadn't gotten a dose of windex in ages and the sliding screen was beat up. Then there's the noise. The room sits below the hotel's restaurant above it. They must have hardwood floors up there or something, because whatever the case, when any chairs or furniture moves, you definitely hear it throughout the room. This was particularly annoying considering the hotel's breakfast begins very early in the morning and what I imagine is the staff setting the restaurant up so you wake up to rumbles of furniture moving. This was the major complaint. For $260 a night, I feel like you definitely deserve better. Upon check-out, I noticed I was being charged for valet parking every night even though I don't own a car. They did fix it promptly, but I'd definitely recommend checking your invoice before you head-off.

Reviews.Title: “What they do have going for them, they do well.”
Reviews.Author: Dalex916
Reviews.Content: I spent the first full week of July here. I booked through hotelclub.com, and received a pretty good rate for the week. So to begin: The Pros: 1. The hotel is in a great location. Little Italy is the best, the food and environment is great. It's close to the harbor and freeway access. It never took me more than 5 minutes to get anywhere from the freeway. It's close to downtown too, and SeaWorld isn't far either. The location is the best feature of this hotel. 2. The staff is very helpful. I never had a problem asking them for anything. I didn't even know I had breakfast vouchers, but they sure did tell me! The room was cleaned each day, and there was no worry about leaving things in the room. 3. The restaurant. The Glass Door, as it's called, was good. At least the breakfast was (we ate elsewhere during the day, since we were about). It wasn't your typical hotel breakfast of juice/coffee and pastries, it was two eggs, toast, potatoes, and choice of bacon or sausage. Which I thought was nice, since there aren't many places close by for breakfast. I'm sure lunch and dinner were just as good. 4. Did I mention the location?
