I don't think I'll stay anywhere else but in Little Italy in San Diego. The CONS: 1. The lobby and shared areas are nice. But the actual hallways and rooms have gone through a hasty remodel. If you're really picky, you might not like that. If you're spending a lot of time in your room, you might not like that. I noticed it and we didn't spend much time in the hotel, but I got over it. The room was clean, and that's what's really important. 2. The rooms amenities. We had the basic room (so I can only comment on that) and it didn't have a fridge or microwave. Disappointing considering the amount of food the Italian restaurants nearby like to serve. The tv was pretty old, probably as old as I am(22). The bed was very firm, even for me (i like a firm bed), and the pillows weren't very comfortable. The furniture is good, but the room is small so it can get tight. 3. Valet Parking. $14 a night. It's only a problem because it should be included or at least mentioned when looking for hotels. It's not as expensive as other hotels in downtown, but it is an extra fee that can add up. I didn't mind, because it is convenient, but I think It's a bit excessive since there aren't that many people at the hotel. I strongly believe that it should be included with the fare. Conclusion: I think that for a night, this isn't a bad hotel. If your planning to spend a while hear, I'd suggest not having a car because you really won't need it. You can walk nearly everywhere worth going, and if not the public transportation is very accessible. Would I recommend this hotel? I would if it's your first time in Little Italy and you don't have a car with you. You'd have to be an avid walker. If you want to spend more time here, some people would probably like their upscale rooms, but not me. I'm going to try another hotel in the area, that is just as close and still budget friendly. It's a good hotel, that could use some upgrades and changes that would probably make it a great hotel, i.e. a better tv, better pillows, and a reduced price valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: HR-Dana
Reviews.Content: This was a fun hotel with a young energy vibe to it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My room location was initially not to my liking and they immediately changed it for me. The desk offered a sewing kit for an emergency wardrobe malfunction and was very helpful with directions. The free courtesy shuttle was a valued service taking me to the Zoo, the Convention Center and the airport. The driver was funny, knowledgeable, friendly and I'm sure he told the truth during half his stories even if I don't know which half! The shuttle is only available 8-4:30pm so early morning and evening travel is on your own. The free wifi is centrally located and could not be picked up at the end of the hall where my room was located. The front desk provided a courtesy cable so I had internet, just not wireless. The hotel is constructed with several outside hallways/breezeways looking out onto interior parking. I would suggest requesting a 2nd floor and above room. If wireless is important, make sure to ask for a room toward the front or center of the hotel. The room was nice. The bed was a bit too firm for my tastes but was fine. There are no real refrigerators in the rooms - they are more like electric coolers. Mine never did work properly and smelled of rotten fish so I only opened that door once! The dinner in the restaurant was very good but the courtesy coupon breakfast left something to be desired. For some reason the cooks could never cook my eggs to order - four days in a row. I would definitely stay again and would not let the negatives detract from booking. The hotel is right in the middle of Little Italy. It's a great location surrounded by wonderful restaurants and fun shops. It's easy to walk around the area and is only a couple blocks from the waterfront. If you are there on a Saturday, don't miss the Mercato just a few blocks away - the Little Italy Farmer's Market was great fun.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was absolutely wonderful and made our trip.”
Reviews.Author: mlewis1948
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called to ask about the weather and what to wear Jazmine was terrific. We were welcomed like we were old friends. Keith helped with our tours and was always so friendly and informative. Greg, the manage was also very helpful with suggesting places to see and go. The restaurant had a wonderful breakfast and wait staff. I just cannot say enough about how at home we felt.

Reviews.Title: “Motel not hotel”
Reviews.Author: RNLeigh17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night last week while visiting San Diego. We spent the prior 2 weeks traveling down the PCH and this was the worst place we stayed. It was the only hotel that couldn't wait to leave. We had stayed at budget lodges and 4 star hotels. The PV lobby is nice enough but wait until you step off the elevator only to be greeted by an outdoor motel. The room smelled musty and felt dirty. Location was ok but a bit too far from downtown / gaslamp. Do not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “terrible everything. yes they have free breakfast- but i would rather pay for my food elsewhere than eat for free here.”
Reviews.Author: jdub21Phoenix
Reviews.Content: location is pretty great. little italy is down the street and has lots of cute restaurants. cafe bellino (i don't remember the name. something like that though) was AWESOME!!!!! but everything else sucked. walls are THIN. rooms are SMALL. if you are there during the school year you will hear the crossing guard's whistle every five minutes starting at 7:30am. and garbage trucks. and airplanes. and there's a 'club' upstairs on the weekends, which you can also hear. service at the glass door, the restaurant upstairs, is cute to look at. and that's it. they had free breakfast which i am ALWAYS a fan of, cause i am kinda cheap. but the service was the worst i have EVER had! two days in a row. so it couldn't have been a fluke the first day. the food was not delicious enough for me to suffer through the idiotic wait staff that move slower and more aimlessly than my two year old. the coffee was also GROSS. asked for cutlery- and the server did not know what i was talking about. 'knife and fork' i told him. english was his first language. it took him about 20 minutes to come back with anything. and that was after i had to ask for it AGAIN. i wanted to punch everyone there. pretty much the worst hotel experience i have ever had. but one positive, we were there because my husband was running in the rock n' roll marathon. the hotel is pretty close to the starting line. and they had bananas and fruit and coffee for the racers who were staying there. at 4:00 am. that was nice. but the ONLY nice thing.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MARYPOPPINS77
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights for my parents at Porta Vista for a weekend in May 2010 for their Anniversary. Since the hotel was in downtown San Diego, there is no parking within walking distance of the hotel. They had to use the valet parking provided by the hotel. There is not a self-parking area. Here is what my parents said: We were apprehensive about parking our car at the hotel because most of the cars were double parked in really tight spots. The valet filled out a ticket noting that we did not have any damage when he originally parked it in valet. We did not use our car the entire weekend. When we checked out of the hotel, and the valet brought the car, we noticed scratches on the front of car and the paint was rubbed off. Before we got in the car, we immediately spoke with the front desk and waited for the General Manager who was not in. Before we left, we filed an incident report with the police. We called Greg, the General Manager seven times and left a message each time. He did not return our calls. We finally got a hold of him on the eighth try, and he said he had to talk to the owner. It is now the middle of June and he has still not gotten back to us. He won’t tell us who the insurance provider is or give us the hotel owner’s name. Unless you come to the hotel by bike, bus or foot, I would never recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ramon was AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: JamieTech
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent! Ramon the reservations manager was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable! He made Mary Kay Director's experience one to remember! We will be back in 2012 and are looking forward to another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses & Minuses of a Unique Property”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Unique location in Little Italy within walking distance of downtown and Embarcadero. Convenient valet parking. Funky but pricey restaurant and bar with view. Easy access to Little Italy bars, restaurants and other purveyers. Easy access to/from Interstate-5. Convenient to SAN airport. Good toiletries. Good sized suites. Nicely redone bathrooms (exp. for irritating items below). Minuses: An obvious redo of a tired apartment house probably built in the late 70's. With that are obvious design issues. My suite endured ongoing and intrusive noise from the restaurant directly above....16 hours a day. Limited and expensive room service. No newspapers in the lobby. No towel racks or shelving for personal items in bathroom. Why? Poorly trained front desk staff (When asked about a local pizza delivery she responded, "I don't know, I just moved here myself."). Highly touted roof deck was actually two chairs and a small table. The major portion was closed off with a locked gate. What are they saving it for? Full ashtays with cigarette butts at outdoor seating areas. Gross. Very slow elevators with stinky stairwells as alternate route. As a caveat for my "No" recommendation below....I would recommend this for the under-40 limited budget crowd. As an executive, this was not a good choice, but I give them credit for creating an upsclae budget property. Many younger European tourists seem to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Shanecostamesa
Reviews.Content: First off, a few caveats, yes, this is a spruced-up motel, but that being said, this place is a great value and is a good alternative to pricier hotels. We chose to stay in Little Italy intentionally and this place could not be any closer (one block) to the main shopping/eating area in Little Italy. This hotel has a surprisingly good restaurant (with a nice view to boot). Breakfast was included in our room rate, which I was not aware of until we checked in. High speed wireless internet is also free. The management did a pretty decent job making this feel like more than a motel and added character and charm where they could. Sleep quality is the area where this hotel gets points docked - if you listen hard you can hear the planes flying overhead (it's nearly under the SD Airport's flight path), although our room was fairly well sound proofed. The strange layout of the underground parking structure also means you may occasionally hear the car alarm or stereo systems reverberating during day or early evening. Probably best to try and get a room on the 3rd or 4th level. Still, I would recommend this place and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. The rooms were nice and clean. Great Decor. The sundeck on top of the hotel was great. The valet parking was ok, but it took a while to get our car especially near checkout time. The restaurant on site had over priced food and breakfast took almost an hour. Great views of the harbor from the restaurant, but we ate at better places throughout san diego. Little Italy is a few minutes walk away, highly recommended. The front desk personnel were extremely nice and helpful. We attended a NYE party there and it was OK except for the fact it was kind of disorganized. They have their act together as a hotel, but they are far from being experts in the party/service business. Close location to airport and san diego trolley system.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: otho1487
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week. The rooms were clean and very functional. Nice efficient restaurant and bar on site. We enjoyed the locations access to most of San Diego, especially the number of good restaurants within walking distance. The staff was great! Yes, we would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for $”
Reviews.Author: Fidalgo98221
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights mid-week and found the hotel to be great value for the money. We would go back in a heartbeat. The location, staff and breakfast were outstanding. The room was small but tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Little Italy!”
Reviews.Author: rose in woods
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and the neighborhood. It was an easy walk to the shopping area and the port area. This was truly a neighborhood type hotel and lots of great Italian food and artsy shops. We were on the 2nd floor and would have liked something higher as we were almost street level and could not leave our balcony door open at night. The view from the top floor was great! The hotel is in the airport flight path,but no noise at night and did not bother us at all.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about this hotel is the FREE INTERNET”
Reviews.Author: mistypink77
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby led me to believe that I'd have a nice stay at the hotel, but the room was small. Towels were gross. Stained carpet. NO jacuzzi/hot tub. The rooftop deck is actually quite nice, but they close it pretty early and there's no sign displaying the hours that it is open. They claim to have yoga everyday, but it's really only every other day at 9am. When we checked in they didn't bother to give us our complimentary breakfast passes and we completely forgot until our second day there. The staff is NOT very helpful or friendly and lastly there was dog poop in the elevator when I left that dump. Honestly the best thing about the hotel is the free access to internet anywhere within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shar0nD
Reviews.Content: We had a room with balcony and views over the harbour. Excellent location for getting around San Diego. We ate in the rooftop lounge twice and both times the food was excellent. The bar and restaurant staff were very friendly and informative. Would definately book this hotel the next time I go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff - Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: cactusbill23
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from a wonderful long weekend in SoCal, and the two nights at the PV made it that much better. The hotel and restaurant (and Valet Parking) staff were friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this place for a number of reasons: Location - perfect for anything in the Little Italy area, which IMHO is the very best of the various downtown neighborhoods. If you are a single 30-something or younger, the "Gaslamp" and "Old Town" party hearty till-you-stagger districts are a short cab ride away, and besides - a cab is much better to avoid the DUI danger, as well as the $20 minimum parking lots over there. If your a bit beyond that age range (as we are) - Little Italy is walking distance charming, friendly, CLEAN, and has plenty of choices for cocktail conversation, Vino Fino exporation, and solidly good restaurants. The neighborhood is spotlessly maintained by the "Little Italy Association", whose workers and trucks are out and about every day. Don't miss the every Saturday 9am-1:30pm Farmers/Munchies Market on 3 blocks of Grape Street (2 blocks from the PV). Its delightful! Back to the PV - the rooms are actually larger than most cookie cutter establishments, and there is an artistic flair to the rooms that defies a category, but a welcome relief from the boring norm of most hotels. The rooftop lounge offers wonderful views of San Diego and the North harbor areas - a great place to sip a libation and make new friends. The Glass Door is a boutique Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner restaurant with a very interesting menu that ranges from regular fare to the exotic (and they do exotic well). Treat yourself to the fresh-made crab cakes and the Smoked Salmon Omlette. BTW - some of the package deals for the hotel include breakfast, which means the place gets swamped from around 9:45 - 11 am check out time, so be early or after that for best experience. The hotel does cater to private functions, so although there was boisterous sound from those celebrations on the "outside" of our north side guest room, the noise was cancelled as soon as the door closed. Oh - and a great bed too! We will stay there anytime our travels take us to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Modern feel in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: Campngab
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service @ front desk. Our room was decent. They had recently remodeled and clearly didn't have time to do all the finish work. There was paint on the tile in the bathroom & carpet, unfinished baseboards, etc. Nothing that didn't make the place acceptable, just not what you expect, especially after seeing the lobby. Room was quiet, bed was comfortable, and bathroom was awkwardly large yet no counter space to set make-up, blow dryer, etc. PROS: The location of the hotel is excellent. Aside from being minutes from the San Diego International Airport, you can easily stroll 4-5 blocks west to the pier and see the many attractions or go one block west to the main strip of Little Italy where you will find pizza heaven @ Filippi's Pizza Grotto. The hotel offered free yoga classes on the roof deck - a very cool little area they host special events at when they're not using it as a yoga shack. The hotel also has a hip restaurant/bar with unbelievable views from the 5th floor balcony. Sunsets from the balcony are gorgeous. CON: Not quite finished room with cheap furnishings. Poorly designed bathroom with no counter space. Pay to park - albeit considerably less than surrounding hotels. And finally - my biggest issue was the sewer vents that are piped right next to the elevators, so every time you get on/off the elevator, you're greeted with the lovely smell of a sewer plant - YUCK! A simple carbon filter could solve their problems, which may be remedied by now. Overall, a nice hotel if you get a respectible price, which we did via the internet.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed given the prior reviews”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous-Atlanta
Reviews.Content: The Porto vista is really a revamped motel, and not really deserving of a full three stars. Mind you, it is not bad, and I would not recommend against staying there, but it just was not as good as I was expecting given many of the prior reviews. First, check-in took a bit long for two reasons: 1. There was only one person working the desk, and 2. The software that makes the key was not working correctly. The guy did finally get us keys, but it took a bit. The room itself was o.k.. A bit on the old side, and opened up on the courtyard/parking lot, and would be viewed as similar to a 1960's motel. The location is good... right by Little Italy and near the airport. Sadly, their shuttle only runs from 8-5. Bottom line, I would neither recommend or warn people off from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “well-meaning, but ineffective staff”
Reviews.Author: travelerx1y2z3
Reviews.Content: I experienced check-in hell at the Porto Vista. When checking in, the desk clerk said there was a problem with creating the room keys. She took me up to my room and used a pass key to let me in. First disappointment, was that the internet wasn't working and when I called the front desk, they said it was only working in the lobby. When I later went down (a ride in the slow, small elevator), she gave me my keys. Up to the room, only to find the keys didn't work. Then down, to the lobby and the valet came up with me and he couldn't get the key to work. Down to the lobby again and agreement that they would move me to another room. I was going out, so decided to do the move upon my return. When I came back, I asked for the new room keys. Went to the room, and it was a mess. Came down to the front desk and they said the computer indicated the room was clean. So, change to another room. This 3rd room was clean, the key worked, and even the internet was working. Throughout this the staff was friendly, but did not appear to know what was going on, and I got the feeling they didn't know how to run the hotel. The room was adequate. The decor tries to be hip, but seems just cheap. More importantly, its clear the renovation of an older motel was done way too cheaply and they are understaffed. For the money, this was not a good value. The location in Little Italy is good, but next time I'll find another place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Incredible ick factor - like camping sans tent.”
Reviews.Author: altrics
Reviews.Content: "Its just one night - about anything will work," I thought. WRONG. On arrival, the front desk couldn't find any trace of my reservation. I showed my printout, and the lady at the front desk flipped through some heavily highlighted computer printouts, finally coming up with the info that they had made my reservation for the wrong night. (It showed the correct date on the printout of my online reservation.) I was hit with a shock once I made it up to my room, after squeezing into the cramped elevator. The room had not been touched since the last guests - trash everywhere, all appliances left on/running - looked like a frat party had just occurred. After calling the front desk, had to lug everything back down for different room keys, then back up to a hopefully better room. Yes, the new one was made up, but I had serious doubts as to the cleanliness. Too many stains, spots, paint spatters, and overall shoddy construction. And the large floor to ceiling pasted-on graphic of a bikini clad 17-year-old did nothing to help the poorly thought-out decor. Basically, nothing looked quite clean enough to touch, so it was like camping without the tent or sleeping bag. It was quiet while I slept, though I saw plenty of partiers on my way in. In the morning, windows out the front looked over the parking area in the atrium space at the hotel's center, and windows on the other side overlooked the street. On my way out, after tipping the gangster-looking valet (uniforms would've been good so you know he's not), a young couple also leaving accidentally dropped a couple cases of Bud light in the driveway in front of my car. Kinda summed up the place. As a young graphic artist, I have no idea what the marketing team was thinking when they helped put this place together.This place feels like it's trying to be a trashy LA fashion boutique, marketing to the kind of young demographic whose parents never took them to nice hotels, so they never acquired the training on how to act at a hotel. And the rooms show the wear and tear from this. Next time I'll be staying somewhere nicer - like a motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: achilles734
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right in the heart of Little Italy. Be aware that a major highway runs nearby, so there is some road noise (but this will be true of most Little italy hotels). While this is not a surprise in a big city, it was a bit annoying that we could not leave the balcony door open at night due to the road noise. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable- the 2 most important factors for me! We upgraded to the 'room with a view' package and it was well worth it. For only a few extra $'s, you get on site valet parking, breakfast and a balcony room. You do not get a choice from the breakfast menu with this package (eggs, toast, potatoes, coffee), but the food is good and the few extra $'s is a great value. The front desk and valet staff were great. The restaurant staff could use some help- we ate breakfast 2 mornings with only a couple other people in the restaurant. Both waitresses seemed quite stressed as if they were very busy and we actually felt like we annoyed them by being there. If you are looking for a stylish, non chain hotel in a great San Diego neighborhood at a reasonable rate then go for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: kirbyfredstpaul
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because the location looked good and I found a good price on-line. It turned out to be the perfect spot for me. The hotel's location is great; easy walk to downtown, and Little Italy's shops, cafes and markets are right out your door. Little Italy is a real gem, a fun area to reside in. At check in, I was offered an upgrade to a larger room, free of charge. During the week, hotel staff were kind and responsive (ie., "where's the blow dryer?" -they quickly delivered it to my door). Restaurant is nice, convenient, offers daily happy hour w/great views of skyline/ocean, and above-average food. As a woman travelling solo, I always felt safe in this neighborhood, day or nite. I did lots of walking around, by myself... Enjoyed the area. When I return to SanDiego, I'll re-book at Porto Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JamesYucaipa
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. Although the rooms weren't super fancy, they were clean and adequate. We had a great view of the harbor and LIttle Italy. Great location right across the street from one of my favorite restaurants, "Fillipi's." The highlight of the trip was the Food and Beverage Manager, "Darien Israel." She was terrific getting us a late check out and seating us at a perfect location at the restaurant with a super view of the harbor. Try the french toast, I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conversion, great view, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: degreemd
Reviews.Content: Location - one block off of the Little Italy main street, Easy access to the 5, airport, shopping, and the bay. Room (407) - Newly redone, clean, clean common areas too. Comfortable bed, lots of lighting, very small balcony (no room for a chair). Tons of hot water! View - beautiful view of the bay from the 5th floor common area. Bring a towel if you're sitting up there in the morning - cushions are wet with dew. No pool, no hot tub, parking $14 a day. We did enjoy our stay at the hotel, but would not stay again because of the lack of pools. It was cute, staff was very friendly, felt safe in the area, and plenty to do within walking distance. We did not try The Glass door, but heard it is good food. For awesome (quick and cheap) mexican try El Indio on Washington - Tacos are to die for and they have a special parking area.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great suprise in a beautiful package!”
Reviews.Author: FLCHICK_10
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Sandiego from Tampa for a highschool girlfriend get together ( we were from Mi and FL) this hotel has an awesome staff, Mitch, Robert, Jerald, Rebecca, Mike(bartender) Nick ( bartender) and Taylor ( bartender) sorry if I left anyone out. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and loved the views from our rooftop balcony. The food and drinks were served graciously at the Glass Door and we never went without excellent service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family and the price was superb. Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: brucezdc
Reviews.Content: Throw out everything you've read about The Porto Vista Hotel because the review I'm writing will be spot on and give you the most insight on the property. My girlfriend and I decided to get away for one night, it was a last second decision. We booked a two-room suite with a balcony on their website. We were a little hesitant because of some of the negative reviews we read about, but we decided to give it a chance. We arrived on a Saturday morning and the person working valet was very welcoming, couldn't have been a nicer guy. We went to check-in but the person at the front desk had trouble finding my reservation. This was probably the only sour part of my whole experience. But since I travel a lot, I always bring my confirmation number with me. Once I gave him my the number, he was able to locate my reservation. The person at the front desk said that they have a suite ready for me but if I wanted to wait an hour, I could get a suite on a higher floor which means we'd have a better view of the city/harbor. My girlfriend and I were delighted by the option and agreed to wait. They overheard us talking about where to get lunch in the area and they quickly suggested their restaurant on the 4th floor called The Glass Door. We got there in time for brunch and the food was amazing. It was so good that we ended up going back to the restaurant later that evening for dinner!!! You have to check out the restaurant if you're ever staying at the hotel or in the area. It has great food, great staff, nicely poured drinks and a romatic view. The suite was a little smaller than I expected, but it was plenty of room for two people. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, the lighting was perfect, the balcony view was great, bathroom was neat and everything just seemed great. One of the best things about Porto is it's location. My girlfriend and I never had to use our car while we were there. Everything we needed was within walking distance. Just right down the street is Little Italy where you can find great Italian food and shops. We went downtown and it only cost us an $8 cab ride. The bottom line is this... The Porto Vista Hotel is a great place to getaway with your boyfriend/girlfriend/husband/wife. It's in a quiet part of the city, but seriously close to a lot of great places. I really don't have any complaints with the hotel. The best gesture they made was pushing my check-out time to a later time TWICE. I called once the night before and they gave me a 12:00pm check-out time. I called again the next morning and asked for an even later time and they pushed it back to 1:00pm. That really said a lot about the staff and how much they're aiming to please their guests. Trust me, take it from me, someone who travels a lot. Most hotels will turn you down if you try suggesting a late check-out twice. I've even burned turned down before the first time I've asked at some places. This place is almost perfect. Only thing holding it back was the size of the suite and it did not have room service, but that's not going to prevent me from ever going back. My girlfriend and I are already talking about going back in a couple of weeks because we had such an enjoyable experience. YOU HAVE TO GO!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - A Gem in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghSp0rtsFan
Reviews.Content: Fantastic is all We can say about this hotel. The location is great. Located in the heart of Little Italy, its within walking distance to dozens of eclectic local restaurants, shops and art galleries. You can even catch the Trolley that tours the city only a few blocks again. It is only 2 miles from San Diego International Airport. Its minutes from Sea World, the San Diego Zoo, Balboa Park, the Convention Center and the cruise terminal. It also has a stunning rooftop terrace with views of San Diego Bay. Our room was awesome. Very clean, with king size bed, a couch and a wonderful spa tub and separate shower with marble floor in the bathroom. There was a bar and refrigerator in the room and the VIEW was incredible. We were on the 3rd floor, corner room overlooking the Harbor. It felt like we were in the Carribbean. Grace, the Guest Service Manager was so helpful and friendly. Gregg, the General Manger was also so friendly and answer all our question and provided places to see and things to do. We enjoyed the Happy Hour and the wonderful food (the chef was super) of the Glass Door Restaurant. The wait staff was so friendly and professional and courteous. My husband Dan and I can't wait to come back. We are from Pittsburgh and we have our share of gloomy, rainy days. The weather is San Diego was perfect – they tell us it only rains there 5 days a year so we can't wait until we see our friends again at the Porto Vista. This is a gem in San Diego. A must stay. We would rate it 5 stars. AND THE RATES ARE SO REASONABLE Bev and Dan from Pittsburgh, PA October, 2009

Reviews.Title: “like a motel, location not too far from downtown, price was right”
Reviews.Author: Grogieur Eoguerwo
Reviews.Content: overall happy got a deal via travelzoo 89 bucks a night room: 2 double beds. comfortable. bathroom needs updating. desk, tv, closet bonus items that were never used: fridge, microwave, hot plate set up like a motel: from inside, i then went up the elevator, crossed a bridge exposed to the outside - this was the motel like part - to my room it was ok.........maybe not if it snowed but hey, it's San Diego clean enough. the toiletries could be better. didn't take them home the front desk were guys....they should hire girls. girls are smarter convenient shuttle service. every day at 8 am, to the convention center. apparently shuttle service to the airport too. probably would pick you up from the airport if you called them. cab ride to the airport was 5 minutes or so. 12 dollar cab ride about a 20 minute walk to downtown. very reasonable would stay there again if the price was the same. for 200 dollars a night, no.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: SRF1
Reviews.Content: The Porto Vista Hotel is located downtown in Little Italy right near the Gaslamp District which makes it convenient for an early evening stroll to shops and restaurants. However don’t eat out anywhere until you try the Glass Door Restaurant that is located on the 4th floor with great views of San Diego Harbor overlooking the passing cruise ships and aircraft carriers. Be sure to get there for about happy hour time when the sun is setting, WOW, spectacular. The free airport shuttle and free wifi is important for me when doing business in San Diego or anywhere for that matter. The rooms have recently been renovated and I love the mural on the wall. I found the Porto Vista Hotel through a business colleague who raved about the service and location. He invited a several of us out for a drink at the Glass Door Restaurant during the sunset hours with the amazing views of San Diego Harbor and from that moment on I stay nowhere else in San Diego but at the Porto Vista Hotel! I plan on bring my family on my next trip since the Porto Vista has suites large enough to accommodate my family all together plus the hotel is near Sea World, San Diego Zoo, Legoland and the Harbor. I highly recommend the Porto Vista Hotel for anyone traveling on business or pleasure convenient to all the attractions and happening places of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel for the Price Point! Fab Service”
Reviews.Author: gringainMexico
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this little hotel. I paid $98.00 per night in Little Italy, which is fabulous. The hotel staff was very nice and the room was lovely for the price. It seemed underpriced to me. It would have been nice to have a microwave, there was a spot for one, but overall, it was great. I was traveling with my dog and other hotels either wouldn't take them or wanted a per-night fee for him. I think I paid $10.00 for the stay for having a pet. I made my reservation directly on their website and got a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: BPolly
Reviews.Content: Walked to everything - Gaslamp, USS Midway, Seaport Village, etc, although the nearby trolley stop would save some steps - $5 for all day pass. The hotel offers free shuttle to airport, zoo, and other attractions. Right in Little Italy, there was no need to go elsewhere for food/entertainment. Check out the Saturday street market - Yum! Our room was great except for the noise of the nearby airport, however with the doors closed it was quiet. Very comfy bed. Fridge, wetbar and microwave was convenient. Big spa-like bathroom. Rooftop cabanas were lovely - check out "Wooftop Friday nights" where you can take your 4 legged friend for a play and have a drink with friends while enjoying the view of the harbour. Best aspect of the hotel, however, is the staff. Very warm, friendly and welcoming. Thanks, gang!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: MeganBusTrav
Reviews.Content: I'm a monthly business traveler to San Diego and this place is a hidden gem. The hotel is centrally located in Little Italy in downtown with easy freeway access for travel around San Diego County. The lobby, rooftop bar and restaurant was perfect to meet clients and have breakfast, lunch or dinner. The view and atmosphere made clients believe I was spending a ton while still staying under budget. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel, newly remodeled rooms and $14 overnight parking(usually 20-30 elsewhere) to top it all off. When work was over I was staying in the heart of Little Italy and blocks away from Gaslamp. Can’t wait for my next “business” trip.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: annacesara
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel during along trip in usa this summer and I must say I found it expensive compared to the service offered but not at all bad. we had a double queen room, clean enogth, without view but quiet. the resturant is good but expensive (I am italian, so I am quite used to expensive good restaurants, and this definetly will never survive in Italy, but compared to american standards is ok) but I must say that i saw one of the most amazing susets I ever experienced form the terrace! all in all I can say I will recommend it to friends except for the rates......

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: iheartstuff
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views of the city. Great location in Little Italy. Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The Glass Door had a great happy hour and decent breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well, its eh...”
Reviews.Author: cheaptravelbug
Reviews.Content: We were driving past Little Italy and found this hotel at the last minute for $95/night, one night. At first I thought I was getting a deal (since it was a last minute) because its in Little Italy and the lobby looked promising. Well the lobby and the rest of the hotel/motel are two separate entities. First, it really looks like a motel. The room itself was OK, obviously they attempted to renovate and give the place a face lift. But I REALLY didn't like the fact that anyone could easily just pop open the window or kick down the door since the hallway was very narrow with high traffic. Inside of the room was bearable, somewhat clean and presentable, I probably wouldn't want to swim in the pool, and it really felt like being in a motel. San Diego is expensive but I could've easily stayed at a business motel/inn for the same price or for $10 more and be more comfortable. The ONLY attraction to the motel/hotel is really the bar with an amazing view of the city. I wouldn't stay here again, but may go to the bar just to soak in the view.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel in Little Italy with Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: schlegal1
Reviews.Content: Located in Little Italy, the hotel is really great--we booked on Priceline for $58/night so it was a steal. It is up-to-date and has the friendliest staff. There's free wifi throughout the hotel which is also great. Our room was very small but clean and suited our needs; the toiletries were from Bath and Body works--lime verbena scented stuff. The airport shuttle from the hotel is free and they also operate shuttles to some of the major tourist attractions. All the staff was ready to help us and to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. We thought the location was terrific. We were on a tight budget and couldn't stay in the Gaslamp quarter but we thought this location worked well. We were close to a public transportation stop (and public transportation was very easy to use) and many things were walkable for us (we're big walkers). The stroll to Balboa Park or to the Gaslamp took us about 20 minutes; a walk to the Ferry to Coronado took about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: castre123
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviewers who say that this is a glorified motel. The rooms are very small. They are about the size of a cheap motel. The bathroom on my last cruise was bigger than this one. The airconditioner in the first room didn't work so we asked them to switch us to another room. For some reason the jacuzzi was only full of water on the weekend. They emptied it Sunday night. I suspect it's because there are so few guests here mid-week. It's disappointing, however, to not be able to enjoy the amenities that the hotel is supposed to have. On the positive side, the restaurant, although small, has a great view and there is a beautiful seating area on the roof. Like the jacuzzi, they chained up access to the seating area on the roof after the weekend so that no one can enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “A bad start and even worse ending!”
Reviews.Author: MelPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I made the reservation through there own website and down loaded the driving instructions from La to the hotel in Sa Diego. I was very pissed after looking for Hawthorne Street as I drove throught SD on the main highway, going 13 miles past the downtown area to call the hotel and be told the driving directions on there web site were in error. When I finally found the hotel, the front desk acknoledged the error on there site and were amused at my anger. They said management had been told about the error by many guests but it was not yet corrected. I then was told they just switched to only valet parking in there garage and there was no parking allowed on the street. I went up to the room, which was not very nice. To turn on the A/C I had to go down on my knees since they had installed a window A/C unit at floor level that had it's control panel on the lower corner. Stupid! Rugs were dirty; toilet seat was broken; shower head was broken; no stopper in the sink which was located in the room; more furniture than the room could accomidate, but no closet. You had a mid sized wardrobe in which even my shirts were to long. Just strange and I had to pay a double rate because they were sold out the first of two nights. Guest computer access at $.50 cents a minute for a boarding pass. No comp breakfast or anything else included in the rate. I tried to check out this hotel on Trip Advisor before booking, but could not find it listed, to my regreat. I had no apoligy upon checkout and was glad to leave. Mel Heifetz

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Lybi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time and would recommend it to friends and return. The staff was excellent. It is close to downtown San Diego and the trolley and we never took our car out of the garage the whole time we were there. We had a problem with our refrigerator and they sent someone up within 30 minutes to fix it. We found the room extremely comfortable and the view from the restaurant was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “"Great location- Legendary customer service"”
Reviews.Author: travelusa057
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is really amazing, Anthony, Jeff, Keith and the other nice guy with the pony tail (forgot his name) etc. The shuttle service is always available anytime we requested. The housekeeping staff needs more training and supervision. Meals are little pricey. Porto Vista = Great Value = Great Service. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: smallcatoh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Little Italy and is only 1 mile from downtown. They have really nice rooms and the staff was amazing. They have a shuttle that will pick you up at the airport and will take you virtually anywhere. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “O-k hotel”
Reviews.Author: kengyen
Reviews.Content: I agree with one of the other users who said this is pretty much a motel. Very convenient to Little Italy. 20 minute walk to the convention center. It seems recently renovated but I think they only renovated the lobby and restaurant and just gave the rest of the hotel a new paint job? They were able to accommodate requests- non smoking, late check out, higher floor/away from street construction - so that was nice. Just a few annoying things. We were in town for a convention. When we checked in they knew that's why we were in town but didn't tell us they had a shuttle. Next day found out they did and that we needed a reservation. Reserved a spot the day after. Still didn't get on because people were late to the one before and therefore took our space on our reservation. So not sure what the point is of the reservation? Also we were supposed to get free parking that I forgot about until our third night of street parking. They said I should have reminded them. Lesson learned on my end. But still frustrating. The room was kinda small - European hotel room small. Not sure comforter was washed. Could have just been the fabric? The tub drain was slow. I know it's a little silly but the two toilet paper rolls were almost gone and housekeeping didn't seem to care about replacing them. We had dessert at the hotel restaurant The Glass Door. The view Is really pretty since it's on the top floor. My bread pudding dessert was dry and overheated? My husband said his cheesecake was good. Overall the experience was o-k.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room, Customer Service For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: hannahbannana
Reviews.Content: After reading previous rants/reviews, here's what I got: Yes, it's a fixed up motel. We stayed 4th of July Weekend. I saw on the hotel website about the parking so I was aware, paid vallet or street parking only. The customer service was unbeatable- the house keeping needs some more training (our room was only half-serviced the second day). Our room was beautiful and very clean (when we checked in)- King, balcony, city/bay view. The elevator in the lobby was painfully slow, and no one mentioned there was a second elevator until our last day. The resturant food was 4 out of 5 (but very busy for the holiday). I was disappointed that the surrounding neighborhood closes down by 10:30pm on Friday and Saturday night. but over all, For Little Italy San Diego on a Holiday weekend, I am more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: wmlv
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Thursday June 25th. They stopped their free parking garage on Tuesday the 23rd and we were told that we would have to pay $15 a day for their new valet parking or find a place to park on the street. I do not mind paying for items if I know about it up front, but I do not like being blind sided. After being in the nice lobby and then having to come out of the elevator to see a motel style courtyard that was a parking lot and under construction was a bit disappointing. These are my only negative comments. We had a king bed balcony room on the 3rd floor facing the landing path for the airport. It was amazing how we did not hear any planes when the sliding door was closed. After reading other reviews about a small room, I was surprised to find a good sized and very well appointed room including a nice small work desk by the door and a small wet-bar style sink complete with microwave, small fridge, and coffee maker. The TV is not a flat screen, I can live with that. The added room safe was a plus and it will hold a laptop. Free internet worked without any problems. The bathroom appeared newly remodeled and was extremely nice with an oversized tub. The bath amenities were wonderful. The sink is a pedestal with no counter space. The restaurant has outside seating with a wonderful view of the harbor and a nice happy hour. The roof has a great deck to watch the sunset. The hotel is one block above the Little Italy section which has great dining options. Try Po Pazzo restaurant also during happy hour. We live in Las Vegas and travel to San Diego a couple of times a year a have stayed in numerous places. This was first time I stayed in the Little Italy section and we spend a day just walking the city. This is a great location for that. We booked this on price and I can easily overlook some of the flaws because it was considerably lower in price than other downtown properties. I was very happy with this property for the price I paid (under $100 a night). This is not a high end property, but is a great place to experience the harbor and downtown area of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: ValGal7
Reviews.Content: All the staff were great-very friendly and helpful- You can walk anywhere- So close to everything~ The elevator was very slow~ so if i didn't feel like waiting~ I just used the stairs and got some great exercise~ I was on the 5th floor and I liked my room~It was fun watching the planes fly by- when my window was closed it was very quiet! They used Bath and Body Works for their Soaps and Shampoo's- very nice- The restaurant (The Glass Door) had a wonderful view and was a fun place to people watch and see the sunset! The "happy hour" was terrific- delicious food!!! Loved the Kobe sliders and the cheese plate- The restaurant staff were all friendly with excellent service~ Fun place- I look forward to staying there again when i am in town~

Reviews.Title: “dressed up motel”
Reviews.Author: bom2535
Reviews.Content: There seem to be two types of room, double queen bed which is just about right proportioned (furniture:room ratio) and king bed with smaller room, and that was what I stayed, furnitures & fixtures are obviously too large for the room and very little space left even for only one person. Something always blocking my way so moved it or moved around. This is upgraded property from the old motel, and it is still pretty much a motel no matter how you look, a nicer & newer kind of motel room may be. Almost everything in the room looked reasonably new and modern, only exception was TV which was last decade leftover. Stayed on 5th floor, only one elevator serving so this was everyday problem, slow and inadequate. Also there is open air penthouse bar on the 5th, not far away from the room so this could be noisy and no privacy. (there are corridor window which everyone kept them shut) , hotel is very near the landing path of nearby airport so it could be noisy at time. few sea view room on the 5th or 4th should be among the first choice. Staff were helpful and friendly, boutique style lobby was attractive and nice but has nothing to do nor correlation with how the room looked. Location is near little Italy as everyone said but there are also many other choices at the same price. Parking is potential problem whenever occupancy hits 60% plus. Shuttle service available to the airport and zoo,etc. looked nice but didn't use so cannot comment. Overall this is unique, if you want to try to stay in modern/very clean motel then this should be good. The rate we've got at the time of stay was not very attractive so might not come back as said, there are many other choices...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WEGO2
Reviews.Content: Room 130 was on the 1st floor so of course somebody upstairs sounded like they were preparing for the marathon the next day, back and forth throughout the early part of the night! The room was small, but it was very nice and clean and comfortable. It appears though that other rooms in this hotel could be extremely nice. We just booked too late to see those! The staff was very helpful. This hotel is within walking distance to Little Italy in San Diego. Lots of great shopping and FOOD!

Reviews.Title: “a bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: einna728
Reviews.Content: online, the hotel looked great, but we were sadly disappointed when we arrived. the front and lobby of the hotel looked great, but when we got to floor our room was on, it looked like we were staying at a cheap motel. the room was beyond small and there was hardly any room to move around, let alone unpack our things. the layout of the bathroom was strange and the sink was outside, separate from the rest of the bathroom (annoying!). the only good thing about the porto vista hotel is that it's only about a 10-minute walk from the gaslamp district...and i say "walk" because the parking lot is tiny and fills up easily, so once you've found a spot you won't want to move your car.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: AZcartrip
Reviews.Content: We booked a king room with a balcony. It was a great room. No extreme noises. Everything was spotless. The room had a frig and microwave with an in room safe, which we liked since we get tired of lugging all of our cameras, etc. around all the time. Being in Little Italy, the restuarants were great. The shuttle service to and from the zoo and balboa park were free and easy. The staff at this hotel were very efficient and pleasant. We recomend leaving your vehicle in their garage and taking the trolley and buses. You can cover a lot using public transportation. Overall, we had a great stay and would stay again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: j1952
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous about our stay after reading some previous negative reviews, but our experience was all positive. Our location in Little Italy couldn't have been better. Many wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Every day we stayed(9 in all) we saw evidence of constant upgrading(fresh paint,etc.).The staff was very friendly, the available shuttle service was a nice touch. Our room(408) had plenty of room in the bath . We did not have any trouble with the parking but could see it might become an issue when the hotel is busier.

Reviews.Title: “It could become loud”
Reviews.Author: busybine
Reviews.Content: There is a hip restaurant and a roof top bar in the hotel. All rooms have outdoor access (like a motel); therefore it can become loud when the weather is good and people party on the rooftop. Good for party people but not recommended for business. All rooms are traditional furnished not was the outside (hallway, restaurant) indicate. Bedding was itchy (hopefully no bed bugs); soap etc. smelled cheap and artificial. Airplane noise was bothering me. Staff was extremely friendly and attractive looking. The view is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Epags
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that with one or two minor changes will be a must stay while visiting San Diego. Location - Center of Little Italy; Parking - within hotel at a very reasonable price. We were pleased it is just far enough from the train and airport that those noises were not a problem at all. The staff was excellent and the overall facility was a pleasure to be in. It appears the hotel is still upgrading....they were still putting finishing touches on the roof top lounge area and our room (501) still had a very old TV/cable system that I expect they will be changing out soon. The in-house restaurant had an excellent happy hour starting at 3PM with $4 drinks with a killer view of the port. The only downsides (which I addressed with the management) was that there was not much lay-down space in the bathroom for your (my wife's) toiletries, I mentioned the TV, and the carpet needed shampooing (apparently they missed that after refinishing the rooms)...They were gracious in accepting my comments. I highly recommend the hotel given its excellent location and very reasonable rates. Of course the rates may change.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money..”
Reviews.Author: ld1244
Reviews.Content: Spent the night here for business trip. Upgraded hotel, at least that's what the lobby tells you. The room was somewhat small, but nicely furnished, upgraded, very comfortable. Large Bathroom. Free Internet. $5 parking fee should have been complimentary. No continental breakfast as previously advertised. In house restaurant upper floor with great view. Had breakfast there, and it was fine. One downside: Airplane and train noise -- which is a problem in most of downtown San Diego. I've stayed in much better places for the money (after wheeling and dealing on the internet) but this time I had to book quickly. Paid about $100 including taxes and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Lawhelan
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Everything is new at this amazing hotel. Built around an interior courtyard it must have had a previous life, but now everything is modern, top of the line, and gorgeous. Our room was comfortable and luxurious. Parking was very convenient and nearby. Service was friendly and professional. But the restaurant/bar is the most amazing- The Glass Door is on the 4th floor with fab views over the harbor from the dining room or terrace. With very few tables it was cozy and intimate, with great food and service. We met friends in the bar and the drinks were excellent- good selection of wines and booze. The hotel is walking distance to Little Italy. I can't say enough good things! We were told they're adding a roof garden with fire pits....

Reviews.Title: “An Interesting Find”
Reviews.Author: somobr
Reviews.Content: We were heading off to the Comic Con in San Diego. the one convention that literally brings San Diego to a standstill and sends hotel prices absolutely rocketing. After many weeks of trying to find a reasonably priced hotel, (Best Western were charging $700p/n) my partner finally choose this hotel. I couldn't find many reviews except recently renovated property, near Little Italy...We took our chances and were pleasantly surprised. The initial feel when you enter the Front Desk is very warm and welcoming, but you can tell it is an old motel that has been renovated. The rooms were "cosy" but clean, with nice bedding, fresh sheets and a nice yet small bathroom. The staff were extremely friendly, however, could probably do with a bit more local knowledge although they did have a helpful attitude, as long as you have the patience. Had plenty of free parking - always a plus, and was one street back from Little Italy's fantastic Italian Restaurants. About a 10 minute walk to the water, 20 mins to the Convention Centre but a very beautiful walk none the less so don't let this put you off. As we were there they were just trialling their restaurant for breakfast and lunch and later they were to open for dinner. All in all, considering we were there at San Diego's busiest time of the year, it was a great little hotel - priced well compared to the excessively over priced hotels for the Comic Con so we were happy with this rough diamond !!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: xgirl76
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night on the last night of our holiday. We picked it as it was convenient to the airport and we had an early flight out. The price was also relatively cheap on a weekend when all the hotels in San Diego were booked out and prices were high. When we arrived to check in we were pleasantly surprised by the bright, recently decorated lobby area. Unfortunately our room was a standard room which had not been redone. The room was very small, which wasn't a huge issue for a one night stay, but the furniture was unnecessarily large for such a small space. The room was clean, however, and the bathroom was fine. the main problem was with the air-conditioning units, which were mounted in the outside wall of the rooms, below the window. These units are terribly noisy, so it was impossible to sleep with it running. And when it was turned off, the noise of the units in the surrounding rooms still kept us awake and the room got very warm overnight. There was also a lot of noise anytime anyone walked by the door. I can usually sleep well even with surrounding noise, but I got virtually no sleep here. The worst part of the experience was when we went to check out at 4.10am. The person on front desk told me I'd have to wait 10 minutes while her computer system ran an audit program, with no apology or offer of automatic checkout. When we said we were expecting a taxi in 5 minutes and had already paid for our booking up front, she told us she'd have to wait to check for incidental charges, but with no mini-bar and no room service available, I'm not sure what these might have been. I suppose there could have been telephone charges, but these could have been charged afterwards with no problems. She reluctantly called to check our taxi was on the way (another guest was also waiting for his taxi) and then wordlessly handed me the print-out of the receipt and went on typing. I had to ask to be sure, but apparently we were done. No such thing as "thanks for staying with us" here obviously. The location of this hotel was actually nice, close to Little Italy and lots of nice restaurants. But if you want a night's sleep, don't take one of the standard rooms and don't expect friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: PREPXPRESS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great neighborhood and has very nice initial appearance. The lobby is beautiful which leads you to believe that the room will be the same, but they are not. The standard rooms at this hotel are very disappointing. The hotel website boasted that each room has a refridgerator and microwave, but there was none in our rooms. When I asked the manager about this, she stated that the website had given false information, but it was their own website! The outside walkways had carpet and the air conditioners constantly leaked onto the carpet, which gave off a very offensive odor. This is definitely just a hotel for sleep only. If you stay here do not get a standard room. I cannot attest to the quality of the suites or any other larger rooms, but the statndard rooms are not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Garsha30
Reviews.Content: Restaurant and bar are finally open on the fourth floor of the hotel. The bar has outside seating that has a fantastic view of the harbor. Rooms are nice, updated, and clean. A very comfortable place to stay with a desk to do work, TV, sink, and fridge. Free internet access. The hotel offers a free airport shuttle which also goes to Sea World and the Zoo. The trolley station is just a short walk away, with quick access to all of San Diego. The walk to Petco Park was just over a mile. The hotel staff is extremely pleasant and responds quickly to all issues. The gave us a free upgrade to a King Bed. When we got to the room, the bed as not made up. They came immediately to clean the room and change the linens. Hotel is a short walk from the harbor, and Little Italy, a nice part of town with numerous restaurants and shops. When we return to San Diego, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: SCVTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage sons, and I went to San Diego for three days, midweek to go on a charter fishing boat. I shopped around for hours for the best deal on a hotel. The day before we left, I decided on Porto Vista based on TripAdvisor reviews, the Clarion website, and other travel sites. I booked the room on the Clarion website. I paid about $140 a night inc. taxes. Websites were unclear regarding parking-some said it was free, some said there was a fee. I called the hotel to find out and was told it is currently free but limited. We arrived at the hotel, which is located north of downtown and just a few blocks from the USS Midway, and greeted by a very friendly staff. I was a little concerned about noise since we were about 2 short blocks east of the train tracks and just south of the airport. Our room was interesting. The far wall was a sliding glass door which was the bathroom door. Thankfully it was frosted glass but provided no privacy-not even on the toilet. It would have been fine for a husband and wife but not great for a family with teens. From what I could tell, there weren't many rooms like that. We were in 555 so judging by the arcitechture, the rooms on each floor below us were the same and possibly on the other side of the hotel as well. Sure they would have moved us if I complained but it wasn't a huge issue. The room ended up being very quite with only an occassional train during the night and planes in the early AM but it was light at night as there was no way to cover the sliding bathroom door and there was a window in the bathroom with no covering. The beds were firm and possibly the most comfortable beds we've slept on. Linens were excellent. The room was fairly clean...my only complaint was the track of the sliding door was sandy and the glass was only clean on the sliding portion. If housekeeping would shut that door while in the bathroom they could clean the track and the glass. It's something many house cleaners make even in their own homes! Remodel is still going on but never an inconvenience to us. Great value in a great location! Also...there is no pool, just a large hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, If not driving anywhere”
Reviews.Author: TerriandDenise
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews from Trip Advisor and loved the great price. However, upon arriving, directions to the hotel were inaccurate. Needless to say we were lost. Parking is extremely limited! First night we stayed touring Little Italy. Mimmos restaurant is the best! It was a nice 5 minute walk down to the harbor. The room we were in on the 2nd floor was very tiny. Oversized computer chair should be replaced with a smaller one. Bathroom was as well tiny. The room was very clean. We booked the room for 4 people and were only given 2 bath towels. Reception of the T.V. was terrible. Both nights we stayed, rude neighbors from the hotel. Suggestion would be to lock the jacuzzi gate at 10:00 p.m. when its closed. Teenage kids were in the jacuzzi yelling at 2:30 a.m. Staff was great to chase them out. If you leave the premises don't expect to have a parking spot upon return. We had to park 2 blocks down from the hotel by the freeway and walk to the car the next morning carrying all the luggage. If there was a continental breakfast, we didn't know about it. The hotel is in a great location to Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PortoVistaReviewer
Reviews.Content: Here is a complete review of our recent stay: Location: Walking distance (5 minutes) to the harbor, USS Midway, trolley, and great restaurants. 5 minute trolley to Gaslamp or Old Town. Little Italy has beautiful architecture, very friendly people, and of course great food. There is a small neighborhood park right behind the hotel that is awesome. Very family friendly and priceless for our 2 year old. Every Saturday has a street market one block from the hotel--fresh paninis, bread, fruit, etc. Hotel: Still under construction, but nothing too major. Restaurant and jacuzzi are still not open. Construction noise during the day is not too bad, turn on the AC and you can barely hear it. Though my husband was more bothered by it than I was. Elevator: So slow we never used it in 4 days, though it is brand new. Construction workers utilized it so maybe that is why it was so slow. Lobby: Absolutely gorgeous. One small room with one computer for guest use, though I was told the internet wasn't working on it since there were so many people logged on to their wireless. Manager: Extremeley helpful and sincere. Upon check in we were given a room that didn't have a view of the harbor. I asked if there was something available with a view and was immediately given a suite with balcony and view of harbor and the hotel was completely booked. (We checked in around 3:30 pm) Rooms: Get one on the north or west side of the hotel and on the 3rd, 4th, or 5th floor. The west side might only have the more expensive suites, but our room was on the third floor, north side and had a balcony with a view of the harbor and the price was for a queen, 2 people. Since it faced north it also had a view of all of the airplanes landing--our 2 year old LOVED watching them and they are very frequent during the day and almost non existant during the night. The plane noise never bothered us. We were the first guests to stay in our particular room since it was completed so everything was brand new. Windows open for fresh air, refrigerator, wet bar. There were 2 tv's, one in the bedroom and one in the living room--not very many channels to choose from, but if you are in San Diego then chances are you won't be sitting in your room watching tv. Some noise from neighbors was heard, but nothing out of the ordinary for a hotel. Bath and Body Works soaps are very nice too. Note for families with young children--some windows have a low sill and open with only a screen that could easily be pushed out--very dangerous when you are 3-5 floors up. We kept those windows locked. Maid Service: Terrible. We didn't have any for 2 out of our 4 nights. We had to go to the front desk to get towels, etc. Luckily the front desk employees were always very nice and helpful. One day I was in the room and a few minutes after I put up the do not disturb sign I heard the maid cart pass our room. I opened the door and asked if they could just take the trash and give us towels and he said "no, you had the card up"....not the best customer service. Shuttle: Terrible. I read previous reviews saying it was great. Not our experience. There was a large convention while we were visiting so the shuttle was available only for them, not other guests. After the convention was over, we wanted a shuttle to the zoo but we were told that it left the hotel at 9 am---the zoo opens at 9 am and if you are not there early you will be waiting in a very long line. We asked if they could make an exception since the shuttle was just sitting there at 830, but nope--it leaves at 9. Funny, just the day before we saw the shuttle give a ride to 3 people to the zoo after they asked at 830. Parking: FREE. Unheard of in San Diego. Overall: Very helpful, nice employees at the front desk and very good manager. Great location. Very family friendly but don't stay here if you are looking for a "sit by the pool" type of vacation. The construction is finishing up and they are still ironing out glitches, but if we go back to San Diego, there is no question that this is where we will stay. Remember, get a room on the west or north side on the 3rd, 4th, or 5th floor--the closer to the west side, the better.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ajyacht
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after reading a bad review on the first hotel I had booked. For maybe $10 per night more we changed reservation for this location. It was so worth it! This should be a beautfiul building when completed. Nice views from the roof of the Bay, watched the cruise ships leave. Close to everything. Walked to dinner, the Red Bull air show the next day, walked back to Little Italy. Room was clean, air conditioning/heater worked great! The only thing I would change is add a hook in the bathroom to hang towels from. Plan to stay in the future. Just hope they won't raise the prices too much when all the work is complete!

Reviews.Title: “Website Errors and Service Issues”
Reviews.Author: arizonamom77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in April 2008. The website states they have a restaurant (open 4/08)-NOPE. It also says there is a 30 person jaccuzzi pool-WRONG AGAIN. It's there but doesn't have any water. The site also has a list of items that are standard in every room. We did not have a "Comfortable two seat activity table or lounge chair with ottoman", and neither did our aunt who was also staying at the hotel. She had a room on the 5th floor that was barely large enough for the single bed, but the bathroom was gigantic. Her room did not have a Microwave oven and compact refrigerator. What really sucked about my stay here was on the last day, we called for a luggage cart to be sent up so we could load our car. The hotel only has two very old and used carts that don't match. We were told they were being used by the housekeeping staff. No offer to have the maids bring one down so we could load our car up or have someone help us with all our bags. We were literally the only guests in the hotel except for our aunt, and the parking lot was full of vehicles from the construction crew so we couldn't even pull our truck up close to the elevator. I had to ask if they were going to have someone bring our bags down since they couldn't let us use a cart, and was put on hold for a few minutes while they scrambled around in the lobby. My room was overlooking them and I could see them all talking to each other. I really don't see why they didn't just do what any other hotel would do and let us use the stupid luggage cart. When I did get into the elevator I saw what they were being used for...one of the maids had a big box of Kleenex; she was putting boxes of tissues in all the rooms. The front desk felt that was more important than making the GUEST'S stay 100% perfect. With the prices they are trying to charge at this place they really need to do everything they can to please the guests, which they do not. Stay away, many other hotels in the area will treat you better! For less!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay if you are looking for economical value”
Reviews.Author: huskertravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in June of 2006. The hotel was basic and clean. We were close to the bay and there was a shuttle to the airport which was our reason for staying here. The room was on the smaller side but ok. There is a nice view of the bay and you can take the shuttle or bus to the tourist are which is not far. The staff was not the most friendly but we did not have to ask them too much.I would say the hotel is a typical Super 8. Very basic with a simple breakfast. Diane

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Rooms, Low Price”
Reviews.Author: seven3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in May 2007 based on recommendations and the forum here at Tripadvisor. I'll reiterate the comments that others have posted here: Pros: 1) The rooms were very clean - a pleasant surprise as the outside of the hotel looks a bit messy (as it used to be a motel and is under renovations). 2) Location - the hotel is within walking distance to the tram stop and all the restaurants in Little Italy. 3) Price - what can I say...I love lower prices... Cons: The Porto Vista used to be a Motel 8; so it does feel a bit dodgy when you first arrive. However, when the renovations are done, I'd assume it will be much better. Note - this hotel is away from the main city center and has a residential feel when walking around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Noise was Terrible”
Reviews.Author: SmoovD
Reviews.Content: Well. This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. They have been doing major construction to expand their rooms. They are one of the cheapest hotels in the area. Close to the airport and within walking distance of the beach and local trolley which can connect you to the other major attractions in the area. The only problem with this hotel is they have been doing major construction for the past year and from what I've seen they won't be done with it till November of 2008. If you like being woken up at 5AM by loud construction noises and even loader construction workers profanity and yelling, this is the hotel for you. Oh, and be sure to stay on the first floor or in a suite otherwise you won't get one of their upgraded beds with the pillow top mattress. You'll be stuck with an oldschool hard spring mattress.Hope this helps in your decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great for the money”
Reviews.Author: mswin62
Reviews.Content: great loaction 10 minutes walk to horton plaza very helpful staff!!! only problem building work but i didn't hear anything till after 8am and very clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Area but....”
Reviews.Author: BSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Great area, except they failed to mention that they were under construction. The room was great, walk in shower, bathtub, tv, bedding, and furniture. The upstairs seating area is where I would have to go if I wanted to smoke a cigarette. It has a great view, till you turn to the left and notice all the constriction work. Really makes the outside look ugly. Other than that, great stay and employees. I might stay there again. Next time I will not pay this amount till the construction work is complete. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Encore- Stay Away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tophercb
Reviews.Content: First the hotel is impossible to find because the neon signs do not bear the name SUPER 8!!! It has another name-brillant! To say there is not enough parking is an understatement.. The rooms smell bad of mold and mildew. It might be cheaper than other hotels in the area, except motel 6 near by, but not cheap enough for the condition of the hotel. It is way over priced particularly if you get a room in the old section under construction. The staff is immune to what must be daily complaints. It is an ownership that is immune to the welfare of their guests as we are told the place is being sold to another chain. Do yourself a favor STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super room in Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: ticord
Reviews.Content: We utilized TripAdvisor recent reviews and fotos and deemed this worth the chance: construction/remodel ongoing . B/C truly large, high ceiling rooms [at least on 5th floor] and easy access to the 5th floor deck with chairs and tables overlooking Little Italy and views of the waterfront for morning relaxing with continental breakfast snacks brought up from lobby area and late afternoon/evening relaxing with a drink before going to nearby Little Italy for dinner. SUPER to not be confined to a hotel/motel room. King bedroom for a couple is ideal spaceous room. Tiny frigibar with modest temp only [mgt should use larger mini refig &/or style with cooler temp] means you need to keep ice bucket full inside it and your then set for chilled soda, snacks, etc. Microwave if needed. Nice cherrywood furnishings. Large bathroom with marble tile floors [could use a wet towel hook or two and there is space to spare for a vertical shelf rack. A/C is perfect when needed. So what - there's construction next door at Motel 8 as part of remodel. So, what there's an add on under construction the other side of the Motel 8. So what - there's no room views. So, what - there's "reach out and touch" jets landing nearby - the noise was Not noticeable and views from 5th floor deck were great! Location is primo: close to Little Italy eats, no street noise, close to trolley, close to 7-11 for day trip stock ups, close to airport. Forget there's no outside or inside grounds! You're going to be out and about on trolley [nearby] and connecting buses to entire City and La Jolla beaches [#30 bus from 1st & Ash or Old Town Transportation Center after trolley ride to it]. Check out Zucchero for a great full breakfast and great pasteries and gelato later in day/evening. Check out Mimmos for a great lunch [thin crust pizza by slice with great salads. Check out any of the many Italian eateries for lunch and dinner [Zia's & Vincenzo, etc.]. Plus, Filipi's for Italian traditional meals and deep dish pizza - long lines wotrh it.
